No comment

Really great brunch at Peaches HotHouse! I went around 2 pm on a Saturday and was seated immediately. Service was good - we ordered as soon as we were ready and were served fairly quickly. The food was great! I got the fried hot catfish and it was huge! The spices were great and having the side salad was a nice compliment. It was so big I don't think another alternative side would be necessary unless you're really hungry. Great experience and would highly recommend!
No comment
No comment

Heard a lot of great things about this place and I am really disappointed. This is our first time traveling to New York and we stayed in the Bed-Stuy area in Brooklyn. My boyfriend and I both ordered a chicken sandwich (his hot, mine regular), fries, Mac and cheese and a cocktail punch special. The fried chicken sandwich wasn't fresh. You can tell it's been sitting under the heater for some time. It was really dough forward and gummy. There was skin attached to the chicken thigh and it was incredibly soggy. I got a lot of gristle bits and not very much chicken. Worst chicken sandwich I've ever had. I should have gotten a hot chicken sandwich from pop eyes or chic-fil-a instead. The Mac and cheese was cold. I got a lot of cold shredded cheese bites. The fries were not fresh. Awful!

Disappointed that this being considered a soul food spot. It's a bunch of Brooklyn transplants serving up under seasoned food. I had the shrimp burger which is nothing more than 4-5 big shrimp with super spicy Old Bay. The Mac and cheese was cold and bland. My husband had a severely over cooked grilled chicken burger. The two stars are for their version of Rum Punch. Would not go back...ever.

This place gets a lot of attn & guests. I recommend coming weekday, but the food is going to leave you wanting more. The chicken is well seasoned, fried, and good. The chicken is also golden complexion

Peaches HotHouse is a great neighborhood option for some hearty food. I went on a Monday evening with two friends of mine. The restaurant is small but cozy and comfortable. I ordered the hot fried chicken sandwich with a side of broccoli and mac and cheese. The chicken was fried very well with a crispy outside and a warm and soft inside. The side of mac and cheese was one of the better ones I've had. My favorite side however was the spicy grilled broccoli. Extremely flavorful and went very well with a big sandwich and creamy mac and cheese. Waitress was very attentive and friendly. I would definitely go back and try the fried catfish sandwich!
No comment
No comment

Yes yes yes yes and yes. I've been here a number of times with my fiends, and each time we come, we always have great things to say about it. The chicken and waffles are ridiculous here. Could easily gain 15 pounds off that dish alone. Their macaroni and cheese is equally delicious. And since because I come here for brunch primarily, I drink a lot of their coffee - it's always fresh and potent. Definitely will be back soon

I'm from the south so I'm pretty particular about soul food and fried chicken.  Fried chicken was perfect (especially for delivery).  The outer batter was seasoned well and still crispy. The meat was juicy and perfectly cooked.  Collard greens were just right!  Just moved to the neighborhood and I can't wait to try more from this sweet spot.
No comment
One of my favorite spots to go to, I'm never disappointed! The food is always good, drinks are amazing and the service is great! I like to get the catfish sandwich w/sweet potato fries.
No comment

Have been here multiple times with the boyfriend and friends and each time the food is amazing!  The French toast and fried chicken are perfection! If you don't like spicy, get the chicken mild, cuz it's REAL HOT. We always go for a side of fried green tomatoes and the shrimp and grits too. We are admittedly pigs and like to try every little thing on the menu. You will not be sorry. There's a particular bartender that we like and sadly her name escapes me at this moment, but she is such a delight and has amazing customer service and we make it a point to always sit at the bar so that she can host us. The cocktail menu is great, too. Fits the cuisine perfectly!
No comment
No comment

Grabbed dinner at this place when visiting a friend in Bed-Stuy. Really good southern comfort food and great chicken! The wait was a drag...1.5 hr wait to be seated. However, the wait was worth it. The fried chicken is the real deal.
No comment

I came here for dinner on a Saturday night with a group of 4 people.  We ordered the fried green tomatoes appetizer, regular fried chicken platter with sweet potato fries, regular fried shrimp platter with salad, spicy fried chicken platter with mac and cheese, and the chicken sandwich with salad.  The fried green tomatoes was delicious, coated thinly in cornmeal batter and topped with fresh salad.  The spicy fried chicken was better than the regular.  It was actually spicy, but not too spicy to the point my lips should be burning.  However, the chicken was dry even the dark meat.  The shrimp was tasty, not too thick battered and crispy.  The Mac and cheese was not very creamy.  The sweet potato fries could've been crisper.  The platters all came with cornbread which was dry.  The staff were very friendly and attentive.  For the prices, I expected the food to be better.  I might come back here if I'm in area, but I wouldn't go out my way to come here.
I frequented peaches  prior to the pandemic. I was so happy when they got added to grubhub. The same quality of food I was accustomed to in the safety  of my own home...kudos peaches hothouse!
No comment
No comment

Finally got to cross off Peaches HotHouse off my list, but disappointingly, the food was average at best. I ordered the Crispy Fried Chicken with a side of Mac N Cheese. The chicken was dry and the macaroni was bland. We were celebrating my friend's birthday, so we ordered chocolate cake for dessert. The cake was the best part of the meal, but oddly paired with fresh blueberries. Service was attentive and the restaurant had a comforting vibe to it, but the food quality was not what I had expected based on the hype.

Still one of my favorite places but so much have changed due to gentrification. My once hidden gem is now a hot commodity within the neighborhood. Bring back the old peaches hot house when the happy hour was five dollars and all the signature cocktails were included, your entree came with 2 sides and not a salad , and black eye peas cooked with ham hocks. Peaches has lost some of its soul, culture , and originality due to generification ; being a native of Brooklyn it saddens me. Despite the changes , peaches hot house on Tompkins is still my favorite. I had the catfish with mash potatoes, the catfish could have been seasoned a little more but was still tasty. But let's talk about the mash potatoes ; first off they don't provide you with enough however they were delicious and will leave you scrapping the bowl and contemplating ordering more. My cornbread was cold and felt like something was missing. My friends ordered the fried chicken along with fries, and were content with meal. Our waiter was very attentive , and the music played was definitely a good mix

A not-so hidden gem in Brooklyn.  Peaches has a couple outposts across the borough.  This place gets a yummy in my tummy award.  Crispy, crunchy, juicy fried chicken.  Generous portions on the sides and they also do up some really tasty spare ribs.  This is definitely a go-out-of-your-way place.  Solid price points as well.
No comment

I was sick for three days after ordering and eating their oily collard green, which I ordered along with their catfish and grits. Placed a call to their management and was told someone would call me back after leaving a message, but of course no one ever contacted me. Never again will I order from the Hothouse, or the Peaches franchise again.
No comment

I placed an order for delivery through Yelp for some last minute brunch plans. The food arrived in 30 minutes! It was delicious especially the fried catfish and cornbread it was a huge hit. I will definitely order from here again!
Throughout the Covid this has been a reliable place with a consistent menu that is amazing! Thank you for making difficult bearable.

Very disappointing. I ordered delivery for my birthday dinner (was feeling too sick to go out) & was truly excited for the quality southern food I was expecting. But the food was greasy, portions were relatively small, and the food wasn't even warm! I had to re-heat the food in the oven when it got here, which seems counterproductive to ordering take-out in the first place. Even the fries were flavorless, soggy, and lackadaisically thrown into a paper bag. I don't know if peaches was having an off take-out day, cuz I saw people post better food on ig who were at the restaurant. But I wouldn't have paid so much for a meal (total was $47.65 including $4.55 service fee and $5 dasher tip) or chosen it for my birthday. The order arrived really quickly (like 25-30 minutes from placing order) and the food tasted good once I reheated it and seasoned the fries. I like their hot spices and Mac and cheese, but would never order delivery from them again. It's not worth it.

This place is dope! Mac n cheese and cornbread are amazing, and I love their cocktails- especially the Goodnight Kiss Punch and Lightning Hopkins. Too good. I usually get delivery (since it is currently pandemic time), and they package the orders very nicely and safely e.g they staple the bag tight! I now order Peaches every week!
The worst the food fell off so bad, I'm very disappointed, customer service also bad, the waiter was rude & he was rushing me & my friend, so he can get the table for the next guest

They have made the most of this quaint and cozy corner space on Tompkins Avenue. This location seats about 30 people total and does an awesome job at keeping this spot feeling welcoming and comfortable. The portions are pretty hearty and food taste great. This is a cool place to briefly read a book at the bar or meet up when you have a small group, I would max it out at 3-4 for people. This is a no frills restaurant with good food and a relaxing vibe.
No comment

The Brooklyn wings, the Hot chicken, the shrimp.. all great reasons to come to PHH, but the vibe is what will make you come back over and over. Service is good as most of the staff is very friendly so much that even the cooks in the back will come out to say a brief hello. The music is a cool background to the fiery flavored food and varied night to night. Overall a well designed food experience catered to both the 1 time visitor or the weekly regulars. I can assure you the transition is an easy one.
Consistently good food; great service and  hands down the best rum (brownstone) punch this side of the Caribbean.

Peaches was absolutely amazing. Both the food and atmosphere was excellent. I went around 1pm it was happy hour but it wasn't busy at all. Our waitress was the bartender and she was really nice. We ordered the artichoke dip, hot chicken (beware it is hot lol; and wash your hands before you rub your eyes), fries, mac and cheese, brooklyn wings, and chicken sandwich. Everything tasted good and I'll definitely come back again!!!!

This place is cute and I really wanted to love it, BUT I think growing up in the South has made the bar for food like this to be high. The 2 stars go mostly to the drinks because they were good and strong, however the value of the meal is not worth it to me personally.

I love the concept and proximity to my apartment but it's not worth it anymore. It smells and feels like a sticky bar/club when the lights going on at closing time. The service is HORRENDOUS, especially during peak hours. The staff acts like YOU'RE serving THEM. HA! Total joke. Took my friends from out of town here and was totally embarrassed. This is the kind of stuff people rip NYers for. May be okay to go here on quieter mornings with a friend who has been here before and just knows the deal. I don't know. I've never had a consistent experience here.
No comment

I am so grateful that Peaches Hot House is open during this chaotic time. This is one of my favorite places to eat in Bed Stuy. It is locally owned. The staff are amazing, polite and super helpful.  Now the food. Where to start. OMG! The Fried Green Tomatoes are a symphony in your mouth. The tomatoes are lightly fried to perfection. It comes with Krispy Bacon, arugula salad with hint of pickled red onions. The salad dressing is delightful. I appreciate that it comes on the side. And the remoulade for the tomatoes has a slight welcomed kick. Just typing this, I think I will go for a walk this afternoon and get some to go. Be patient good food takes time and you can taste the care. It is worth the wait. Peaches specializes in Southern Food. Can't go wrong with a place that has real hot sauce on the table (pre Covid). #deliciousness
Great spot this is an extension of the original peaches it's a hidden Gem that's been here for awhile in which I stubbled upon a few days ago. The food is good in the neighborhood.
You really can't go wrong with their fried chicken. I come here for that and other comfort food. Great service, fun environment. The best place to carb load!
No comment

When ordering expect triple the wait time. Organization is not at an all time high in this establishment. The kitchen will take forever for your food. Time estimates are not accurate. Front of house staff is pleasant and trying though.

Always great food and service. I suggest the salmon cakes there amazing. I would recommend my family and friends.

I ordered the fried chicken meal with the spicy chicken and a side of Mac and cheese! If you are looking for a guilty pleasure, this is the place! The meal leaves you feeling satisfied and content! And the spicy rub on the chicken is so good, not mention some of the moistest corn bread ever!!!

The food was so good, and the staff was friendly and funny! I had the catfish (hot) with a side of collards and a Memphis Minnie cocktail. I enjoyed all of it! The fish was perfectly spicy and crispy, and the collards tasted like they'd been simmering all day! This southern girl was very pleased!
This food was nasty. I just ordered my food from seamless. Peaches fell off . Highly disappointed the mac and cheese taste and smell stale. The fried chicken is disgusting.

I know I am late to the party, but it was my first time visiting this establishment! I took my mom for her birthday and let's just say, now I know why everyone raves about the FOOD! We even took ordered food to take home for later!

I order here all the time. The salad, shrimp and catfish are all good! I didn't enjoy the fried green tomatoes.

Sooww good! Got the hot chicken with French toast. Bomb dot com! The hot chicken is spicy but so good. Goes perfect with crusted French toast and syrup.

The chicken and toast was delicious! I asked for the hot chicken and it was indeed hot. I also ordered a Lightning Tompkins and a mimosa which were really good. Shaquana makes great drinks and was the most gracious waitress. I definitely have to come back.

The food was amazing. It was walking distance from our Airbnb and we were glad we found it. The service was great. The restaurant is small but can accommodate a group up to maybe 6. Enjoy!!!

Granted I'm not from the south but freak me if this isn't the best fried chicken I've ever had. Plus the food comes out bananas fast (but still tastes fresh). They are very efficient.

Ordered the chicken sandwich, catfish meal, and hot chicken meal. The chicken sandwich was on point, paired perfectly with their sauce. The catfish was delicious. I got it nice and hot and will be ordering again! The hot chicken was ok. Both meals came with fries or salad but for the price, I would have much rather had a real side instead of fries as both the sweet potato fries and the regular fries were super bland and super oily. The salad was good, but a $18 meal with one piece of catfish and a small salad is super over priced.

Usually the hospitality here is outstanding. Today a few co workers and myself stopped by for a early lunch and was extremely disappointed. The waitress (tall and slim) was very rude and took about 20 minutes to come and take our order. We are really big fans of this establishment however, customer service means a lot. Normally when we go customer service is fantastic not sure what happened today!!!!

Had heard a lot about this spot from friends and had high hopes for their fried chicken.  Tried the spinach and artichoke dip which was good.  Then had the "hot" chicken and French toast.  The chicken was a disappointment.  First, it was wayyy to spicy.  Second, the breading/coating of the chicken was too thick.  Reminded me of KFC.  The French toast was not bad though.  Overall, Pies n Thighs is still much better (and closer).  Would probably not come back here.

Food great I had their shrimp sandwich & macaroni .. I order off of doordash & the food came hot. I'll definitely go back again for the shrimp sandwich & macaroni.

Actually came to this establishment on Easter Sunday in the afternoon, but didn't end up getting inside until the evening. The wait over 60 min wait time was definitely a turn off. Once we entered,  I had white the change of heart. Our waiter was attentive and our meals were served in a timely manner. The fried chicken was pretty delicious and their drinks are strong. On top of that you get a great portion for the (reasonable) price that you pay. Don't see myself coming back for a second time.
No comment

Peaches HotHouse you are truly incredible, I had a spectacular experience here today. Great for a group of friends. I was advised to try their Peaches Hot Mess, which was excellent, but all other menu items were fabulous too. Great. Fantastic service and staff. We can not wait to go back.

Strolling through bedstuy and finally got the chance to indulge here. The fried chicken and french toast is unique because,  it's usually ALWAYS chicken and waffles and not everyone likes waffles! This is hands down thee Best french toast I've had. The idea of it being encrusted with granola, guarantees you won't get a soft and soggy mess of french toast. The bourbon howy peaches pairs so well with it, I didn't have to use syrup with my french toast. The bourbon honey peaches does all of the work. Highly satisfying and will return to try dinner!
Fried chicken you will think about for weeks (think Nashville spicy) and amazing greens! The staff and bartenders are great too. Come hungry- you won't be sorry!

Really great chicken! Both the fried chicken pieces and the chicken sandwich are great. Cornbread was good too. They messed up my order the first time I went but were kind enough to refund me! Will be going here regularly!

The Mac and cheese was soooo bomb, the hot chicken sandwich was great too! Cornbread was a little dry, but nothing that a little butter didn't fix. The collard greens were yummy too. I was so happy with my meal. They have outdoor seating too. It didn't seem very busy around 5 on a Wednesday so you could easily get a seat.

The food used to be very good. But going recently the fried chicken sandwhich was still raw and not seasoned great. And the Mac and cheese had uncooked cheese. Covid hit them hard.

I enjoyed myself at peaches yesterday for brunch!!!!! My only disappointment is the collard greens were spicy and the bourbon cake tasted better without all the confectionary sugar on it. The iceberg wedge salad was amazing along with the fried chicken!!!! The French toast reminded me of Dunkin doughnuts roasted coconut doughnut which I absolutely love and enjoy, the hot sauce was good the girts were okay. I had a nice time the music and environment was relaxing and I can't wait to visit again!!!!!

Music 5 stars, my drink 4 stars(Sweet Georgia Brown) but everything else 3 stars. My appetizer, fried green tomatoes, lacked proper seasoning and the comeback sauce was scarce. Entre consisted of catfish (hot option) and mac and cheese. Fish was ok but mac and cheese needed MORE cheese and a pinch of salt.  The timing of the food was  also off. Tables are small so it made for an awkward moment when the entrees arrived in the middle of eating my appetizer. Lastly the service was cool.
No comment

I am a regular at peaches shrimp and crab on Grand ave, this is what brought me to this location. Staff at other location is more friendly and attentive but I like the food and vibe. Just wish all locations had the shrimp sandwich.

I read reviews on this place and wanted to come few weeks back but the wait was too long.  Was able to come today and didn't had to wait.  Whew.  So right off the bat, it is a very small place with few tables and a bar area where you can also dine at.  There are ample free alternate side parking around.  So came during brunch hours which usually I don't like because I like to freely browse through their menu.  But here, I didn't mind because the brunch item menus are stuff that I wouldn't mind trying.  So I got the fried chicken with a side of fries.    It comes with 3 pieces and wow, they are fried to perfection and none of the pieces are dry at all.  I got fries but totally can swap for other sides (free of charge).  Mine was around $17.  My wife got the fried catfish with broccoli.  Man I cannot take the heat and neither can my wife.  The fish was really good and portion was amazing, but man what a kickkkkkkkkkk!!!  The spice is rosemary and cayan peppers.  If you are a fan of hot food, this is right up your alley.  If you are not and is a chicken -hit like us, beware!  My son got the boneless chicken with French toast.  While he only ate a few toasts, he really enjoyed the chicken.  So much that he took some of mine.  Oh yeah, we started off with fried green tomatoes and man, that was amazing with the tender fried tomatoes with the aioli sauce.  All in all, great experience and our waiter, Sam, was terrific.  Definitely worth trying.
No comment

My favorite peaches. The food is slamming, the drinks are epic. Sister Rosetta is my go to cocktail. It's basically a rum punch that I can't go to this place and not have 5 of them. Brunch is insane and the chicken is to die for but I'm black so I tend to like chicken. Also staff is so nice here and so attentive.
No comment

This was a last minute date between my siblings and I. It's really laid back small spot in BedStuy. They were really accommodating and seated us three quickly. The staff was cordial. This definitely satisfied a fried chicken craving I was having. The fried chicken is so crisp and well seasoned..not dry at all. I have it with mac and cheese, which was pretty good too. I cant remember the cocktail I ordered but it was good and was moderately strong. I have no complaints except for the fact that I thought their kitchen closed really early compared to the time they close..almost an hour.

Ordered an absolutely amazing fried chicken sandwich. Also tried the house cocktail, which I personally did not care for because it was far too sweet. I'd definitely return for the food though!

I order a chicken breast, a wing and sweet potato fries and regular fries. The fries were old and cold. The chicken breast was a quarter of the size of an actually chicken breast. The wing was very dry and old.  I will never order from this place again.

Peaches is AMAZING!!!! Their service and our waiter were also amazing. I went for brunch, I was seated immediately. My order was taken in a timely matter, our waiter came to my table several times to assure everything was going well. I got the French toaster and fried chicken and it was heaven send I will definitely recommend coming to peaches!!!!!

Peaches is AMAZING!!!!! My friend and I were visiting from Atlanta. We chose the hottest flavor they offer, which was a mistake. LOL! Literally, the hottest thing I've ever experienced. My lips were on fiiiiiire and nothing could help. Their watermelon salad is meh. But! The Mac and cheese is so decadent man, I could go on for days. Please try this place! PLEEZ

Found through black owned businesses on DoorDash. Had the mac and cheese, shrimp sandwich, and fries. Everything tasted authentic. From the crust on the mac and cheese to the spiciness of the shrimp sandwich. It's a pricey $15 sandwich, but worth every bite.

I have been here many times. Thought I did their review.  No matter. Today was my best experience.  From the hostess to the bartender Randy. He was super duper awesome! . We had the Brooklyn pilsner and The White beer from Bushwick.  Both delicious. Randy took our order quickly.  The food was fresh and scrumptious lyrics delicious. We had the flounder with shrimp and grits and green. Everything was Cooked and prepared and presented in a 5 star manner. Hot and seasoned well. My guest was from NJ and already planning next visit. Randy deserves a raise. Great personality and service.

Where do I begin? I've been longing to eat at Peaches for a while, and finally decided to go today! We had the pleasure of being served by the lovely Ilham, who was so gracious throughout our entire dinner. She was very knowledgeable about the menu items and even recommended adding a side of honey for our hot chicken! The meal was great. The hot fried chicken was crunchy on the outside and filled with flavor in the inside. I also enjoyed my side of macaroni and cheese. Guys beware, the hot chicken is VERY hot, and I love spicy food. I had to have several glasses of water.

This place is good for brunch. It was not too crowded when I went. They gave me a lot for what I ordered. I was so full that I could not finish my grits. I would come back to try the crispy grits. They looked very interesting.

Unfortunately I got food poisoning from here so I won't be back. I came for Sunday brunch and I had to wait about 45 minutes, ultimately got sat at the bar. It's a pretty cozy space so I wouldn't suggest it for a large party. I ordered the bbq shrimp and fried grits, and brussels. My food was actually really good so I hate that it made me sick. Service was great and quick (bar usually is at most paces).

The Catfish was fantastic, it was flavorful, succulent, and moist. I've had catfish down south and it was right up there with it. The Patron Margarita was the right dosage for me lol (strong and balanced). I would definitely recommend this nifty establishment to anyone coming down to the Stuy.

I got food poisoning and so did my bf. Went there to celebrate his birthday - too much dry seasoning. We both ordered the fried chicken and thought it was good while eating it. Half way in we both felt like something could be wrong. But the chicken was so hot all we tasted was seasoning. 2 days later and im still sick and my stomach is in shambles.
dont order hot honey chicken unless you can handle real spice. i learned this the hard way, and it was inedible and made me nauseous. mac and cheese ok but kinda bland
Came today and ordered the 1 piece of catfish which included a salad ... $18 .. never will I EVERRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRRR come back to this place.

Subpar. I ate here (Tompkins Avenue) a few months ago and can hardly remember what I ate, only that my friend and I did not enjoy it. My drink, however, was tasty. Too tight. Too cramped. Don't like sitting on top of people when I eat; however, if the food was, at least palatable, I wouldn't have mind it.

Peaches knows fried chicken. Crispy, juicy, and -- this one might be the most important -- well seasoned. Each time I order it, I always try to save at least one piece to eat cold the next day because it's so good that I always end up craving more after eating it. All the sides I've tried are amazing, but I always return to the mac and cheese: They make it with cavatappi, a rare but perfect shape for mac and cheese, and it's never mushy or bland. I used to live right between two Popeye's and was bummed to move to a new street where Popeye's isn't as readily available, but Peaches has filled that fried chicken-sized hole -- a high achievement.

I ordered fried green tomatoes as an appetizer, and fried chicken with a salad. My drink was a Sister Rosetta! The food was delicious and the service was everything ! My only advice is that there should be a sign on the restaurant, and the interior needs a makeover.
No comment

Yessss. I AM A FAN.  I came here today after reading an article about the best fried chicken in NYC. Luckily I came across this gem. Upon arriving, I was greeted immediately. And not one of the types of greetings that are generic, but rather a warm, polite and gracious greeting. I ordered the fried chicken meal (2 of them) and a side of Mac n Cheese. The spice levels range from regular, to hot and extra hot.  Of course i ordered the regular to be safe lol. My order came within 15 minutes and I was off and running to my home. Immediately,  i opened the box. It contained 3 pieces of chicken. Not sure if it's always 3 pieces or because of how I ordered (I asked for 2 pieces of chicken breast).  Irregardless,  i noticed a few things, 1st the pieces are not large in size BUT they are meaty and flavorful. 2, They have a smal kick. The batter is light and tasty. It doesnt overwhelm the chicken. The chicken it self was very very juicy. The mac and cheese was very good. And 3, the Corn Bread, lets just say I wish i ordered several more pieces because they tasted that good. I definitely recommend this place. The staff are very nice and accommodating. The food is delectable. I would give it 5 stars, but, there is always room for improvement, like..... a larger piece of cornbread lol. Kudos.

Peaches HotHouse is tasty and has a reliable menu if you are looking for "soul food". My favorite on the menu was the hot chicken sandwich. My least favorite was the catfish (the batter is too thick and not crispy enough). They also have a delicious and unique cocktail selection. Definitely be prepared to wait - this place is tiny and does not take reservations.

My husband and I are taking advantage of the kids being away.  I had a hankering for home fried Chicken and did not want to go far.  Went to Peaches Hot House and had to wait about a 1/2 hour but Wint was well worth the wait!  Our server Serena was efficient and friendly.  Chicken was exactly was I wanted and My Husband who is not easy to please enjoyed his Catfish, grits with cheese and eggs.  We saw the fried green tomatoes and ordered them after we ate. We ate them before snapping a pic but we have the other dishes!  Really love this place!

I had the pleasure of dining here for breakfast during the weekend of Afro Punk(August). There was no wait. Me and my sister ordered the Hotfish and eggs for breakfast. This place is very comfortable as far as size, and they have the table layout not too tight together. I highly recommend coming here for brunch. The prices were pretty good as well.

Great place to eat!  My coworker and I went after work and enjoyed the food so much that we simply cannot stop talking about it! The catfish appetizers were tasty, melted in your mouth and comes with their delicious dipping sauce! I had catfish for dinner with macaroni and cheese and collard greens....yummy! The cocktails are so fantastic! We will be back there very soon!

So my first time eating from here was not what I had hoped. Their food is pretty decent, not what I had expected. When I think of southern food, I think of comfort and goodness. The best thing about here are the Brussels sprouts and the fried chicken. The Mac and cheese was decent. The Mac isn't creamy, it's more so noodles and cheese. The collard greens are bland, cornbread is a bit dry, and the grits could be cooked a lil more. Besides the chicken and the Brussels sprouts, they have amazing hot sauce. It has a sweet spicy taste. Not sure if I were to come back, if I did it would be because I forgot I had food from here.
This place is overhyped. Nothing special. Over priced. Gentrified chicken. Disservice to southern cuisine.

Went there today with my mom and daughter - so good!  Small and busy place so prepare to wait, although Sunday at noon we were seated in 20 minutes. We started witty fried green tomatoes - loved the spicy mayo on top.  Mom had the chicken sandwich - really very good although I like the fries a bit more well down. Daughter had the chicken and toast - way more food than she needed!  I had the breakfast special- eggs, potatoes (done perfectly) bacon and French toast.  Ton of food and superb.  We will definitely be back!

Went here randomly for a mid day lunch with my husband. The Rosetta "rum punches" were basically just juice. We ordered additional shots to add to it because they were that disappointing. Hubby had hot chicken with sweet potato fries and boasted that they were the best sweet potato fries that he had ever had. He's kind of a sweet potato fries snob so this speaks volume. I had the mild chicken and Mac and cheese. Plate was tasty but I kept feeling like something was missing but couldn't place my finger on what the something was. Chicken was fried to perfection ...like the perfect crisp but could've def been more seasoned. The hot sauce on the table was perfect for those like me who like a pinch of spice but don't particularly enjoy spicy lol. Would return casually ....

Listen. If you haven't been here yet...idk what you're doing because. This place. Is...DELICIOUS! I'm not the biggest fried food fan but when I'm in the mood, I need it! I ended up getting the regular fried with greens. Man. The chicken was fried and seasoned to perfection! Greens were really good too. AND THE HOT SAUCE? im not even a spicy fan but it was so flavorful with the perfect hint of spice. They seriously need to start selling it. A couple other favs my friends got: catfish (YUM!), Mac & cheese, sweet potato fries, and the cheese grits! Deff can't wait to come back and try more things!

I am a brunch connoisseur and Peaches did not disappoint. I had the French toast, fried chicken, eggs and grits. Definitely recommend the shrimp and grits as well. Orgasmic. The drinks were nice and strong. The only downside of this place is the customer service is non existent. Because of this it earned them 4 stars could of been a 5 star if they did better.

This is one of my favorite restaurants. I've been here countless times. I love everything about it. The food, the drinks, & the overall feel of the place. I was first introduced to it by my wife. She knew I had a affinity for spicy food. She read an article about how it had the best hot fried chicken so naturally I had to see if it true. It is by the way. All in all I would definitely recommend this place. I went today for my birthday & as usual I enjoy it

It took forever for my group to be seated (hour+). Admittedly it was a big group but still.... for me the chicken sandwich was a bit on the dry side.. I gotta say the food was just decent. Just get something different on the menu. They got other specials that look good.

I ordered the crab cake,coleslaw and cornbread. What an expensive disappointment. There was very little crab in the crab cakes, more like bread cakes, and the seasoning was horrible. Coleslaw was tasteless. The corn bread was passable. I wasted $23 plus tax, delivery and tip on this garbage, never again.

Peaches Hothouse on Tompkins was a go-to for me when it served loaded baked grits and peaches french toast. During covid, that location removed those items from the menu and informed me that I would have to visit the nearby, larger Bed Stuy location for those things, which I did. The other location is not as good and takes muchhhh longer to complete take-out orders (no less than 30 minutes). The other location also doesn't make the loaded baked grits, and the grits they do make taste really bad (I gave them 3 shots to get it right). Now, if you're interested in chicken, mac and cheese and other common soul food dishes, HotHouse is still the place to go and the other location seems ok for those items. This review is more a rant about the removal of the french toast and loaded baked grits.
No comment

My experience at the other location was okay but I did say I would return to come up with a better rating as I felt everyone raves soo much about Peaches. My friend choose this location and my experience was even more forgettable here. Came here on a Thursday afternoon this location is even smaller we decided on sitting at the bar and the dry bartender girl gave us the menu. I ordered the boneless chicken and French toast. The chicken while very crispy was like boneless thigh meat so I didn't really care for it being that I am a breast girl. The French toast was big and fluffy on what I believe was challah bread which was good too. The drinks were weak as hell I had some kind of bourbon lemonade and it tasted like neither of those things. There was no service from the bartender and to me if you are in the service industry you should at least have a personality. Peaches, I really wanted to like you I thought we could've had something, but we just weren't compatible!

A perfect middle for sure. Fries were good too but not super crazy. The greens were really great. Not easy making those just right and they did a good job with it for sure. Awesome cocktails too. Place is definitely worth a visit. I'll be back for sure to explore and try out other stuff on their menu in no time

The menu has small plates and larger plates along with their famous sandwiches. I got the catfish and my friend got the chicken sandwich. We both got the hot heat, which was the perfect amount of heat. I would definitely come back here again and try their brunch menu.

This was thee most amazing homey atmosphere And the FOOD IS TO DIE FOR ESPECIALLY THERE DESERTS. Me and my besties got really nice and enjoyed each other's company, this place is that place.

I hate to give low reviews, but I really wanted to like Peaches, I heard so much about it, and being a southerner I was ready for some country/soul food. But man Was I let down, maybe it was the location I was in because there are two that I know of, or maybe I got the wrong thing (for the record I got the "nashville hot" chicken). But my chicken was a disgrace to the nashville style, not wet with sauce, not hot, and not that great as just fried chicken. It was just a breast seemingly bombarded with cayenne and a light tabasco marinade. I would not be so peeved if it were more so advertised as a take on the style, or something of the sort, but ashamedly I have to give this place a pass.
Excellent food, great neighborhood spot. Hard to get them on the phone sometimes but always worth the wait.

My wife and I ate brunch  here on Sunday, we arrived at 12:35 and added our name to the dry erase board in order to be seated. I recommend showing up before twelve or after one, there were a lot of people waiting to be seated. The wait was approximately twenty minutes; the seating is limited because of the small dining area. The crowd started thinning out at around 1:30. The food was excellent. I had the catfish with eggs and grits. My wife had the fried chicken with collard greens; we also tried the fried green tomatoes with bacon and arugula, it all tasted great. The portions were more than enough. We were served by Sarina, she was the best. We will definitely be returning. I gave  a 4 out of five because of the wait time and the crowded seating area, Other than that it is well worth it.

Updating my review to one star due to my experience at Hothouse last night 1/6/17. Despite it being less than 10 degrees Fahrenheit, the restaurant had little to no heat running forcing us to sit at the table in our winter jacket and gloves to wait for our food. There was also only one server working (on a Saturday night), so it took a full 10 minutes to even get a menu. Everything about the temperature and service was unacceptable. If your heat is malfunctioning, you should close he restaurant until it's fixed. Additionally, it looks like they changed the tomato on the hot chicken sandwich from a cooked tomato to a raw tomato. Total downgrade. Overall, it just seems like the owners don't care as much about Hothouse anymore. It was so poorly run. Really a bummer, because it was one of my favorite spots a few years ago.

Great 1st experience! This restaurant is small, with just a few tables and about 8-10 spots at the bar. If there's nothing open right away, know it is worth the wait! Tried the loaded grits to start and the fried chicken for the main entree. Both options were delicious. I will be back!

I Have ordered from here multiple times in the last few weeks I'm sad I order out so much but I'm frustrated because the last two times we're sub par I get it it's Rona season however my fries we soggy my two orders of mac and cheese barely had cheese the inconsistency with this place is unbelievable the Mac was so goos the first couple times so the last time I sad meh it's prob just a bad order didn't complain now it's worse today like they just put cheese on top and put it in the broiler I don't want to be dramatic but I want to cry cause I'm hungry and this is a pandemicccc and it's hot I  want to eat good food and not have to cook in this hot ass heat I'm so annoyed sigh not ordering again cause it's hit or miss not cool ..Fries aren't even fully cooked smh !

Went here for the first time on a Friday night with my boyfriend and we really enjoyed the food. We didn't have to wait too long. We had the bbq shrimp and crispy grits as an appetizer which was very good. My boyfriend had the fried catfish (Nashville extremely hot) which he enjoyed but it was veryyyy spicy of course, with Mac and cheese which was delicious. I had the fried chicken with French fries and we shared collard greens. Everything was delicious! & we're definitely going back.

I simply love peaches hot house - I used to live a few blocks away and would roller skate there almost every weekend for the delicious French toast coated with oats.. it is truly impossible to only eat there once and not come back.

There's something to be said for the new Bed Stuy, it's amazing and terrifying at the same time but thankfully Peaches Hothouse is one of the great things about it. The food is stellar, the service is OK (save for the amazing Bartender)  and the location is easy and breezy for the rest of Brooklyn. I really enjoyed my time here and look forward to coming back sooner than later ;)

My first time here, the food is delicious. The service was fast. It's a more intimate setting. The music was good. I had the friend shrimp and cheesy grits.... so good.. I will be going back. My friend had French toast,also good. The spinach dip appetizer is amazing. If your thinking about going just go, you won't be dissatisfied.

Came here last Friday evening with a friend for the first time. Venue is small, but we only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table. I had the chicken sandwich, it was Delicious!!!! Everything about it from the slaw to the pickles made it perfection. The Mac n Cheese was above average and the spicy broccoli was very tasty. The drinks were delicious as well, I had the whiskey iced tea served in a mason jar, very good. The reason I didn't give it 5 stars was we really couldn't find the server to get another round of drinks or to get our bill. It was a busy Friday, so I get it but they should prob have an additional server on the busy night so they don't miss out on customers who want more liquor. But I'll definitely be back, because again that chicken sandwich was really good!

Excellent food! Excellent service! Good ambience! I love the flavors, and options to choose yummyness.

Ordered from this place this morning, even got a phone call from them with a substitution suggestion since they were out of Brussels sprouts. Waited two hours only to have them just cancel the order on us last min. What was the point. Waste of time.

Nice little soul food spot.  Seating isn't the best but the fried chicken is.  Cool side options.  Have been here for lunch a couple times.  Nice affordable lunch menu.  Had the fried chicken sandwich, pretty good.  Good spot to eat and catch up with friends.  Chill and casual vibe.
Got the hot chicken and a salad for my side. Everything was subpar taste wise. I definitely make better fried chicken. Not worth 20$. Maybe 13$

So I came into peaches this past Sunday for a quick order of two fries. We waited about 20 minutes but that was all good I know they have high customer traffic on the weekends. When they eventually called us in for our fries the bartender, a man with glasses gave us our total which was $10.89. I then tried to pay with Apple pay only to realize I had to pay with card so my sister who was with me offered to pay as I didn't bring my card with me. Her card does not have a chip on it and the bartender gave us the card back asking "where's the chip?" Once again I just brushed it off and we both looked for cash to pay with. Luckily my sister had 11 dollars in cash which she gave to him I was about to turn around and leave until my sister reminded me that we have to wait for the change. We waited about 2 minutes until I realized the bartender had gone back to what he was doing and was talking with other servers. I spoke up and asked him about the change and he said he didn't have any change for us. I was shocked that instead of telling us he was going to let us stand there waiting for the change he went about his business and we had to ask him for it. We ended up leaving and to some while 11¢ may seem trivial it's more the fact that he thought it was ok for us to stand there waiting for the change instead of telling us the situation. I won't be coming here again.

Cute little  place made you feel right at home. Only con it was little cold being seated close to the door. Other than that everything else was great. The wait wasn't long and service was really good. I had big portion sized shrimp that was very fulfilling and well seasoned.

Service is great but flavor-wise it's very disappointing. I think Peaches gets is rating from its charm but the food just isn't worth the hype. Chicken is dry, mac and cheese is bland, Caesar salad is just... mayonnaise. There's better soul food out there.

Fried chicken was great, it was fried and seasoned perfectly!! I I ordered the fried chicken dinner which came with a side salad, but I subbed it for Mac n cheese which was a $2 up charge. This place has potential, if they would only season the chicken with something besides hot pepper and buttermilk. To be honest I don't go here for their main draw, too bland. The shrimp and grits are great. I love how they make little fried or baked "grits squares", I just made that name up. They cook it in onions, peppers and tomato sauce. Definitely not skipping out on flavor there. I also love the short rib sandwich. It's beef which is always a plus and it's a nice size. This isn't too far from me and I want to love it but that chicken tastes like cardboard. There is nothing wrong with a little salt, garlic powder, etc. The chicken has zero flavor, I wish they would cater to the whole community's palette.

I've been here 3 times never had a bad experience! I always get my fried chicken HOT! comes out perfect & juicy. It was busy when we walked through the doors but got seated less than 3 minutes. I just really want to say thank you so much to our waitress Shaquana!! Super super nice and so helpful! Sweetest woman there! Thank you so much!

I came here with high expectations of amazing southern food given it's Zagat rating and high remarks from friends. It was a lazy Tuesday afternoon and I came with a group of work buddies. We arrived and the service was extraordinarily slow for being pretty empty. The food took forever to come out, the waitress was inattentive and confused about menu options. I was very unimpressed by the service. The food was not great, very little chicken in my fried chicken and French toast. The French toast was mediocre and the chicken was dry and over fried very unimpressed with everything this menu has to offer. Will not come back and do not recommend to another person.

I'm no Nashville hot chicken expert but I really enjoyed the fried chicken. I got it regular spicy and it was fantastic. Also loved the loaded grits and mac and cheese.  Service was super friendly - it's always a plus with the waitress makes my kids smile.

first time i went food was excellent went again with boyfriend and the food was horrendous would not go back at all

I ordered hot fried chicken with a side of collard greens to go. Definitely worth the 30 minute drive from Queens. The chicken was crispy and delicious just a little too spicy for my liking...my lips were burning. Will probably go with the regular fried chicken next time. Collard greens were excellent and those little pickles were sweet and yummy too.

I wanted to make it like three and a half, but Yelp doesn't allow. The food is good, the chicken is actually really good. The food I would give a high rating. Everything else just blows. The staff is like barely pleasant and theyall just kinda do the bare minimum to run the business. They're not really friendly and always give you the receipt while you're eating without knowing if you're done drinking or ordering.
