I've held my tongue for years, but after this last meal, I have to be honest. The service here is terrible and the food isn't great either. I ordered two of the shrimp sandwiches to go, and got home to find two boxes packed up with nothing but sad-looking hamburger buns and some fried shrimp. Missing was the aioli that was promised and the coleslaw. It was dry, horrible, and could have been found at any local public school cafeteria. When I called to complain, first they swore up and down that they didn't make a mistake, then they said "well, sorry." Sorry?! My order was $60. The least they could do was refund me the $30 in dry sandwiches. I've been going to Peaches on Lewis since it opened, where the food and service are far superior. I hate to leave a bad review for a chain that I love. But, Peaches Hot House always disappoints!
Love love love there aioli that goes with the fried chicken, they need to bottle that stuff. It's so good. The food is pretty good as well. It's a little place so expect to wait.

It was my first time here yesterday and the food seems pretty decent. The thick cut bacon was deep fried to a crisp and the avocado toast sat on a nicely charred and chewy flatbread (although I would have like the avocado slices versus as a guac). My friend had the impossible (meatless) burger and said it was very convincing and quite tasty. My biggest issue with the place was the slow service. Everything was just SO SLOW, but it was hard to get upset at the servers because they were all quite friendly. If we could just speed things up, it would have placed 4 stars for me.

I went here a while ago, the lunch food was ok. I like the brunch better, the atmosphere is cool and it's a great place to go with friends or a small very small party. The wait is usually very very long.

I'd like to thank Peaches Hothouse for restoring my life. I waltzed in here in here post Kwanzaa crawl after visiting five or so bars and I needed sustenance and Peaches delivered. I'm pretty sure I ate with my eyes closed and inhaled the food without chewing because it was that good. Mac and cheese and mashed potatoes get a special mention for getting the job done. And the bartender for gracing me with much need water.

This place is going downhill. Came back after years expecting to get the same friendly vibes, amazing grits but they just missed the mark on so many levels. Yes the spot is small we all know that. But the vibe was off the waiter were dry and I explained I didn't like my drink and she kept it on the tab. It had a slight spoiled taste to it given the muddled strawberries might have not been fresh. The catfish was good. The loaded grits were not good we barely ate them the sour cream tasted off. The granola French toast was good but they gave no syrup we had to ask the folks sitting next to us. Never asked for a refill for my guest coffee just completely inattentive poor service n basic food. Will not be coming back too many good spots to come back to this
No comment

I called to see if they deliver and the staff member told me I had to order delivery through the Cavier app. It was very easy. We ordered the crispy chicken sandwich, chicken with French fries, mashed potatoes, greens, and mac n cheese. The crispy chicken sandwiches were ridiculously delicious! I loved the mashed potatoes but the greens were not my favorite...not sure what they are missing but they are missing something. My daughter didn't care for the mac n cheese, I thought it was ok. My niece loved her fried chicken. Overall, I would recommend this place simply for the crispy chicken sandwich.

The chicken here is awesome! Juicy and crunchy and spicy and delicious! The salad that comes with it is also good and well-dressed. The sweet tea is way too sweet-because it's the premade Lipton kind. They make their own lemonade and it's really good, so the subpar tea is even more disappointing. The Brussels Sprouts on the side were super tasty but a very small portion for the cost. I've had the fried green tomatoes a bunch of times and always love them! So it's a semi-mixed bag, but if you stay away from the tea (even in a cocktail it's just a mouthful of sugar and artificial taste) and don't mind mini vegetable servings, it's a great dinner!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Haven't been here in years. The time before this the service was horrible, and my food felt rushed and I vowed not to return. But I decided to give it a try during covid to support small business and I was starving and literally 2 blocks away. The food was back to it's original taste and magic I fell in love with years ago. Although it is in to-go packaging it felt like home. The grits were warm and cheesy how I like it. The French toast and fruit amazing even the coffee tasted amazing. Hopefully once inside is open the service can mirror the food quality.
No comment

Please beware that they do not fry their chicken completely. I order their fried chicken and noticed that it was pink inside. Normally fried chicken is either brown or white once you bite into it. However, here it was pink. The head chef tried to justify its appearance, so I just sent the chicken back. To make matters worse, I called the corporate office and spoke to one if the owners, who was equally as arrogant and defensive as the chef. That said, I will never return.
No comment
Omg I love peaches hothouse. Be prepared to wait a bit, since everyone else loves it too. The food is delicious and the prices are cheap. I always want to go back
No comment
No comment
No comment

Must try in NYC. Small restaurant and can be easily overlooked on a street corner in Brooklyn but it is a must stop. If you are in the hunt for great fried chicken like I am, then you will be in heaven. Get the specialty dish with 3 pieces of chicken. I love spicy so I get the hottest, but trust me the very spicy is VERY spicy. Chicken is tender and crisped to perfection. Also, great cocktails. As an out of towner in search for fried chicken at every city I visit, this is my favorite.
No comment
No comment

The place was nice but the service was absolutely terrible.  It's not a big establishment at all for them to forget about us.  They sat us down in a corner and literally forgot that we were there.  Folks came after us they sat them and served them another couple came behind them they sat them and served them before us.  They never came back to ask us what we wanted.  Terrible service.
No comment
No comment

Yesssss to the fried chicken n Mac n cheese for lunch today yummmmm. Bae had French Toast n Chicken that comes with a peach compote delishhh. I've been to the Lewis ave location and it was ok, but this lil spot tucked on a corner has the best fried chicken hands down! Thank you for a great dining experience!
No comment
No comment

My visit here was long overdue. I finally decided to stop by this afternoon to see what the hype was about. I absolutely love southern comfort food and that's what they serve. The customer service was great, it was a small hole in the wall spot. Honestly the food was extremely mediocre to my surprise. I was expecting so much more from them. We had fried catfish, fried chicken, loaded grits & mac & cheese.. ALL lacked flavor. I personally wouldn't return for food.

Service was amazing, food came fast, atmosphere was great, food was delicious! What more can u ask for? He space is a little small but that makes it more intimate. I ordered the extra hot catfish. It's hot! You've been warned. If I could go back I would have ordered he regular hot. Overall awesome place that I will be sure to visit again next time I'm in Brooklyn.

Ok upon arrival we were Not greeted on getting a table so we sat outside without putting our name on a board as per the waitress. But she said we could sit there fine. Although it wasn't a good idea because the MOSQUITOS WAS EATING ME ALIVE! The gentleman I was with kindly ran across the street to get me some Off Spray thank God. Then we received lukewarm water and asked for ice that she never brought to us. We had to ask the server to bring it, which he did promptly , Okay so now to the menu my companion was seeking something a lil lo carb or a salad options. The waitress was not helpful at suggesting anything, "I guess still upset we sat OURSELVES LOL". My first was called something Bourbon Tea was watered down not great . The Brownstone punch  aka Sister Rosetta was as good as the other location. So he ordered a of Merlot she didnt suggest sweet or dry smh. When he got it ! Lawd it was a plastic cup like the lukewarm water. He asked for a wine glass and she said they dont have wine glasses wth... Food was good but the service SUCKED!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small place kind of tight seating area but the food is fantastic. We had the fried chicken, the shrimp sandwich, shrimp & grits all outstanding. They did not skimp on alcohol on the happy hour drinks. For dessert we had the bourbon cake which was soooooo good. Definitely a place we will be re-visiting many times. Street parking, what else would you expect in Brooklyn.

I was introduced to peaches a few years back by a friend who knew the ins and outs of NY eats. At first bite, it's juicy, spicy, and satisfying all fried up in one plate. Just came back recently and it's not as great as I reminded. The chicken wasn't as flavorful but maybe it was just an off day. Service was quick and the fried green tomatoes is a must have.

Delicious!!!!! All the way from California, I was staying in Brooklyn and  went to grab a bite for dinner. Juicy fried chicken, amazing sides!!! I will be coming back if ever I come visit New York again

The food is so amazing here that I had to write the review at the table. I had the catfish with creamy cheese grits. I never ate grits before but I am officially in love. This place is extremely small but the vibe here is very cozy. I can't wait to come back here. The exterior would have you walk past this hidden gem!

Peaches Hothouse vs. Peaches (restaurant)...Just go to Peaches on Lewis if there is a wait.  The food at both is great!  However, the variety and scenery is better at Peaches.  Peaches HotHouse is very small and they don't turn over tables that fast.  To be fair, once you're seated, you don't wait long for your food.  While you're waiting, you will enjoy the music but try to go to Peaches on Lewis instead.
Good spot during COVID . Food was good and drinks were tasty . Was outside dining during warmer weather and social distance tables

I've heard so much about Peaches Hothouse - had to try it.  Went simple with the hothouse specialties, chicken with a side of collard greens and shrimp with a side of mac.  The shrimp were pretty good, the mac - as much as I love mac'n'cheese - was just not my thing ... it tasted just sort of pasty and definitly did not leave me wanting more.  The chicken wasn't bad - wouldn't say the best I've had but had a nice crunch to it, probably would have liked a bit more flavor.  Collard greens weren't all that memorable to be honest.  Overall, can't say I hate it nor did I love it - I would try one of their sister restaurants though.
No comment

My spot for my very hot fried chicken. I can't find that heat anywhere else. My drink of choice is lightening. It has blueberries, bourbon, lemonade, and mint! Bartender is great. She made me a hot toddie that was awesome!
No comment

As a Georgia resident, I'm always skeptical of fried chicken places north of the Mason Dixon line, but this place is pretty good.  When they say hot chicken, they aren't kidding!  I like spice, but I ordered the hot and there was one more level above it in the form of Nashville hot.  My order left my lips tingling and eyes starting to water.  Not the best chicken I've ever had, but it was definitely good.  I can't imagine the type of person who orders the Nashville hot - if you're masochistic, make it happen!
No comment
No comment
Came here for brunch with my girlfriends. I enjoyed the music, food, drinks and service. It does get pretty crowded here so try to come early for brunch.
Best Damn Chicken I've ever had .. Found place by luck & I'm so thankful I did..Can't wait to return..
No comment
No comment
Each piece of chicken is blessed by GOD himself. Some of the best chicken I've ever tasted. The waffles are on point too.  Can't go work with this place.

My first-ever foray into Brooklyn, and a friend took us to Peaches HotHouse.  Arriving around 6:30pm on a weeknight, there were only two tables available, and by the time we were done there was a line out the door.  Great timing, but for good reason - the food here is fantastic!  I had "The Best Chicken Sandwich Anywhere" and I ordered it "Hot" just to be safe.  Others had regular fried chicken, BBQ shrimp, and mac & cheese.  My chicken sandwich was definitely worth it.  Fried crispy on the outside, but still juicy on the inside, not too heavily breaded, and just the right amount of cool, crispy cole slaw to balance out the fried-ness.  My only complaint is that their definition of "Hot" was NOT hot at all for me (full disclosure, I love spicy food), in fact, I didn't taste any spiciness at all.  Still, the sandwich was worth it.  I sneaked of few bites of everyone else's plates and they were just as good as a southern house should be.  Who woulda thought - southern food is good in Brooklyn!
No comment
Learned the hard way that the extra hot chicken is actually HOT. The food is pretty good overall. The place is small but everything I have had there has not disappointed.

Came here randomly for brunch on a Sunday afternoon.  Wasn't too crowded as the sister restaurant Peaches.  The food was really good.  I ordered the shrimp and grits, the only thing I wish that they give you more grits.  Usually some places don't give you enough shrimp and they actually have a good amount shrimp and not enough grits so my friend and I ordered another side of grits to share with the rest of our shrimp.  It is very small and limited space inside.  With that being said we didn't wait at all for a seat like I normally would at Peaches in Bed Stuy.
No comment
No comment

I came here to grab an early dinner before fasting for Yom Kippur. I had the Blackened Catfish with mac and cheese and burnt broccoli on the side. Nothing like a little soul food before going to shul to pray for my soul. Delicious.
No comment

Today was my first time eating at Peaches!!! Food was A1, AMAZING. The drinks were good. It's a cool little hole in the wall with amazing southern food. I totally enjoyed! I for sure will make this a regular. Thank you.

I've been here few times and each and every time, I left w a very happy smile and belly! The fried chicken is addictive!! crispy battered that was sooo delicious w moist yet flavorful meat, I usually ordered the original/regular chicken instead of different spice level, I can take spice but did not want the spiciness overpowering my chicken flavors, I'd like to add sauce if I want to, but I was happy without it in general.  An order of chicken came w half chicken cut into 3 pieces on a white bread, a choice of side ranging from mac and cheese to sweet potato fries, and couple slice of equally addictive pickels! service is quick and friendly, place is small, wait can be painful especially on weekends, so remember to put your name by the board first thing you got there!! Now go get your chicken!!
No comment
No comment

Close to our Vrbo, Peaches was the perfect spot for a late meal. The food was the best we've had in Brooklyn this trip. Hot, delicious and perfectly served. We're planning on many visits during our 2 weeks and in Bed-Stuy.

I just ate there. We waited for 15 mins. (Not bad) to be seated. But there was a bit of a wait to order. The food was pretty good.  They forgot to serve us water when my date and I arrived but immediately served the people who came in after us. After we had eaten and was ready to pay the bill, a bottle of water was placed on our table.
No comment
No comment
No comment
The atmosphere was fun, the service was great and the food was both amazing and reasonably priced! I got the corn pancakes and they were both delish and filling.

Ok let me be really fair. 4 stars for the ice water with lemon. If I ever come back to this place. I'm definitely ordering this!!! So why 2 stars you may ask. Well for starters I thought the place only paid half their light bill because it was so damn dark. It was not even a sexy kinda dark. It was that dark when half the lights are out. That dull dark because the back lights are only on! I spoke with the manager about it and she says "oh we did some renovations and it's just more open". What the hell does that have to do with the damn lights?! If you didn't know any better you would think the place was closed. Well being the person I am I gave her the suggestion of tea lights on the tables and bar. This will add some light life to the space. She thought it was a great idea. Now on to the food..  I ordered the Fried Green Tomatoes. The bacon salad on top was everything - they could have left the FGT in the kitchen. Tomatoes were cut way to thick and lacked seasoning.  The fried catfish was ok. The crust looked as though it was was nice and deep fried, but it was soft.   Uhhhhhhh! The mac and cheese lacked favor and CHEESE! I guess since it was Tuesday they didn't get the cheese dlvy.   The cornbread ... I already said enough negativity. Let's just say it looked like cornbread.  Will I come back  for another meal .... Uhhhhhhhhh ... that will be a NO Alex! I will give the waitress 4 stars. She was really nice.  She was so kind when she took back my 4C powdered ice tea/lemonade mixture. That was awful!

ordered chicken wings yesterday  which consisted of the drum part of the chicken wing they were big greasy dry and flavorless  I've ordered in the past and  my experience was good. however this time I was disappointed .
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

column3: Town of North Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: I was really surprised tonight coming here tonight. The service has really changed!!!!!! The waiter was really rude, and supposedly forgot to place my order. Two hours later I'm still waiting on my food. To then get my food , and our order are wrong. Although the manager did give me a discount that I'm so grateful for. The waiter Samuel didn't do a good job at all I'm assuming he saw two black men and didn't want to services them. He asked both tables how may I help you but never asked my friend and I. I'm not going to drag it
No comment
the hot, fried chicken sandwich is mouthwatering and the aioli sauce is the cherry on top.
I ordered the sausage omelette that came with cheese grits and you're chose of white or wheat toast with a side salad and the broccoli.  I loved it !
No comment
Food is absolutely delicious. If you're visiting from out of town, you HAVE to visit this place. The fried green tomatoes were delish and the hard fried grits were new to me and I loved them!
No comment
No comment

The food here is absolutely great. Love the atmosphere the customer service was also great. Cleanliness is very important to me and everything was very clean and beautiful. Thank you for the amazing experience
No comment

The chicken ate was delicious!  I got the spicy and it didnt disappoint! Crispy spicy deliciousness. iwhat Peaches need help with is their side dishes. The collard greens was horrible! Too much vineager The french fries was dry and lack flavor. The only thing That was mildly edible was their mac and cheese. The drinks ( my friend and I had the Georgia brown) and it as delicious and they werent cheap with th bourbon!! The service was nice and the vibe was cool.. the bathroom was also very clean thumbs up.. just step up your side dish game.
No comment
No comment

I don't know if we came at the wrong time or if we ordered the wrong thing but I did not have a good experience. I got the country sausage egg scramble and it was disappointing. The service was also disappointing and slow. The water was .... interesting, and whatever you do, don't get the lemonade. Overall, I feel like I should have ordered something different.

Listen, no funny business. This place definitely needs better organization. The food was too good for this to get less than 5 stars. This was my first time coming and despite the wait. The menu selections, the pricing, the combination of food was everything I didn't know I needed. My whole meal was perfect and the bourbon iced tea was the sweet cherry on top. Loved this place and will definitely be back. Hopefully next time it'll be a little more organized and we can get seated quicker.
Best fried chicken. Great atmosphere. Small and cozy. Try the spicy fried chicken. Amazing whiskey cocktails. I mean the fried Chicken is the Bomb.

I went here late night for some chicken and all I can say is wow! First off, the server I had was very kind and helpful. Secondly, the chicken is to die for! Seasoned so well and not even greasy. It was the best fried chicken I've ever had. I strongly recommend this place to anyone!
Ordered the chicken sandwich with a bunch of sides - so freaking good !!! Will def be ordering again!

So I came here yesterday for the first time and ordered the HOT fried chicken. It was hot and spicy just the way I like it. I also had the fried grits which was kind of bland, but once I put a little salt and pepper it was perfect. I can't wait to return to try their sides like the bacon potato salad and the collards greens which I heard is delish.

I'm a usual here since I live in the hood. The chicken is to die for but why 3 stars.... everything else was so so. That buffalo cat fish sliders was soooo horrible, my goodness what a combination! There was barely any sauce on the damn thing. However we ordered a side of grilled broccoli which sufficed, but the main course was a total let down man. On another note the Mac and Cheese is okay as well. Nothing to holler and make you do backflips over. You can always tell if a restaurant is good is the can cook the basics well. Peaches may be bomb on the fried chicken but other than that, uhhh thats about it. Don't like me get started on the blackened catfish.

Although service was terrific and the vibe pretty great...being your typical BK hipster hangout (which I love by the way), unfortunately the food fell a bit shorter than my expectations given all of the great yelp reviews. Had the pulled pork appetizer (forget the name - something jam) and it was pretty good when smeared across the sesame seed cracker and topped with the pickeled onions it came with. Booker T. burgers for my sister and I (reg burger topped with a piece of fried chicke), and for my mom another burger that they had on their list of daily specials (was just a reg burger with an onion ring on top). All three burgers, although juicy, were extremely bland. Collard greens on the side was honestly the best part of the meal...my mom and sister second that emotion.
No comment

Came here for brunch with a couple of college friends and loved it! I had been a good hour early and the waitress (her name escapes me but she did have really pretty glasses) was so welcoming and understanding. We caught happy hour right in time and opted for the $6 Bartender's choice drink.... they were amazing! The perfect mix of a Long Island and a mimosa. The food took a little longer then usual (unfortunately they have a very small staff) but the drinks made up for it.

Food is good, drinks are good, people are friendly, only thing I didn't like was the place is super tiny and tight spaced, can't even stretch out your arm, because your so close to people right next to you, I say order to go, the food is worth it, would have given the place five stars if they get a bigger place, at least one I can wait inside for, not outside on a bench, yeah I told you a tiny place

I am so grateful that Peaches Hot House is open during the chaotic time. This is one of my favorite places to eat in Bed Stuy. It is locally owned. The staff are amazing, polite and super helpful.  Now the food. Where to start. OMG! The Fried Green Tomatoes are a symphony in your mouth. The tomatoes are lightly fried to perfection. It comes with Krispy Bacon, arugula salad with hint of pickled red onions. The salad dressing is delightful. I appreciate that it comes on the side. And the remoulade for the tomatoes has a slight welcomed kick. Just typing this, I think I will go for a walk this afternoon and get some to go. Be patient good food takes time and you can taste the care. It is worth the wait. Peaches specializes in Southern Food. Can't go wrong with a place that has real hot sauce on the table (pre covid). #deliciousness

Ok, this place is literally everything you're thinking it is by just looking at the photos. So when you walk in, if there's a wait you put your name on a dry erase board and the amount of people in your party. It was super crowded but I only waited about 15 minutes honestly. Our waiter was super nice; I wish I could remember his name, and was really understanding when I asked to change my side order last minute. Food came out pretty fast, and my oh my was it great! Not everyone can perfect fried chicken, but when you come across a place that does .. You've hit the jackpot! (Drinks are yummy and strong too) definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for w super chill, laid back place to just stuff their face at!

I order from Peaches all the time because I live around the corner from this restaurant. It's usually a hit or miss. I stopped ordering from them as much because they went up drastically on the prices. Crispy shrimp sandwich used to be about $13, now it's over $16. Too much. The last time I ordered I recieved HOT cole slaw and molded food. HORRIBLE!!! Also I ordered their home fries (potatoes) and they are not the same as they once were tasteful now they're dry. They are not consistent with their recipes or cooks. How can you raise prices but give inconsistent, molded, mediocre food!!!!I WILL NO LONGER BE A LOYAL CUSTOMER TO THIS PLACE
Great food and service. In the heart of Brooklyn visiting and wanting breakfast, what a pleasant surprise! Delicious French toast and great vibes all around, would come back for dinner!!!
No comment

Just had grits and fried chicken on a recent trip South and I was incredibly disappointed. I found myself yearning for Peaches' fried chicken and grits which was waaayyyyy better than the most hyped restaurant we went to. Stay cool, Peaches, stay cool.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Fried Chicken is absolutely delicious as is the Mac and Cheese! Must haves for sure. Also got the Blackened Catfish which was super salty, maybe I got a bad one as I had been looking forward to it based on other people's reviews. Giving 4 stars because of that!
Favorite southern style comfy food in BK. Closest taste to true soul in the collard greens. Love the spicy fried shrimp (but be careful the extra hot is hooooot... but so good youll take the pain).
No comment
No comment

The wait for brunch on Sunday morning was long but the food was wonderful. Very flavorful and cooked well. The fried chicken needs more seasoning, but the grits were on point. Would recommend and visit again.
No comment

This could be the best fried chicken in NYC. Packed with flavor, crispy skin and moist on the inside. Comes in regular, hot and extra hot. The hot is definitely the way to go. Just the right amount of heat to make you grab a drink but not overwhelming enough to make want to put it down.

As a  southerner I am a huge fan of chicken and waffles. Imagine my excitement to see chicken and French toast, grits and eggs on the menu!  To my surprise the chicken was good- but not great.  Good and crispy but not much on the amount of chicken under the breading.  The French toast, on the other hand, was AMAZING!  Good atmosphere, friendly service and pretty good prices.  I will be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Had a chance to finally visit this place. I was actually confusing it with the other peaches on Lewis Ave (which I'm not too fond of) until a friend made it clear that they are not the same establishment. So I went there on a Saturday night around 9....big mistake! Wait time.....45 minutes but I was going to wait. This was my one chance and I was going to take it lol. It's a cramped environment. Tables and people hovering over each other; there's a small waiting area right in front of the door which is separated by a heavy black curtain to keep the cold off of the dining room floor. We stood in the doorway and about 50 minutes later we were seated #overit we were finally seated and were placed closer to the door (so cold) but when I asked to change to another table they didn't hesitate to accommodate. We finally ordered. For starters....the loaded grits and the main dishes: I went with the fried chicken with Mac and cheese and my friend ordered the shrimp with grilled broccoli and another side of kale. Let me tell you both dishes were amazing. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the grits and the kale but everything else....A1. Definitely looking forward to going back but I'll try their slower times (if that exists lol)
No comment

I went to peaches on a Friday evening after work with one of my friends. We did have to wait but, it was only a 20 min wait. The staff were nice, while the vibe and music were on point. Everything they brought out the kitchen I was in awe of. I finally received my Southern Chicken Sandwich with fries and side of mac and cheese. It looked soooo good. The reason why I gave it 3 stars was because I found 2 medium sized bones in my sandwich; it was also dark meat. I went to ahead to take out the bones and eat around the small fatty pieces. I thought this was how they made their sandwiches and I should have asked more about the sandwich prior. So once we were done eating and were asked how the meal was, that's when I find out there wasn't supposed to be bone in it. And that a mistake was actually made. I was just told, if I said something I could have got a new one.  And he was like we're not trying to kill you, lol. It would have been nice if they discounted my meal after that. Fyi, if you find a bone in your sandwich don't hesitate to let them know. It's not supposed to be there. I just wish I would have been able to enjoy the sandwich the way it was meant to be.
No comment

This is one of the best breakfast experiences I've ever had! Great atmosphere, delicious food, and great presentation. Most of all, the service is fantastic. All the waiters are really fun and sweet. The cook even came out to ask us how we'd like something prepared and he was just as pleasant as the waitstaff. Excellent!
No comment
Grod was excellent. It is very small and the wait for a party of 3 on a Sunday in the early afternoon was about a half hour long. Worth the wait though!!

Food is great, well seasoned fried food. However, the service is terrible. Came twice and each time waited a long period of time to be served. First time it was not busy and we were dining outside. Waitress dropped the ketchup and yelled that other co-workers need to do their job better and overall just lacked being attentive to customers outside. Another group complained about the same thing I am writing. Second time accompanied by my partner who is pregnant--was suggested to sit at the bar while wait,  the hostess suggested this  from across the room, she didn't even take the time to come over and give us best next steps. Food is good but I value customer service too.
No comment

This place was awesome! The food was phenomenal and the customer service was great! Fairly small due to that there weren't many tables so we did wait about 10 min but it was well worth it! Definitely must try if you are in the Bed-Stuy area!
No comment
No comment
No comment
Best Hot chicken in NY! My favorite neighborhood spot with some seriously good vibes. Get the hot chicken platter and some Brussel sprouts too!
No comment
No comment

This place serves up some of the best fried chicken in the city. In terms of sides, I would definitely recommend the sweet potato fries over the regular fries. We were also able to find parking nearby with no issues.
Food is amazing. Wait can be long depending on the time you go. The fried chicken is amazing. The spicy fried chicken is really spicy. I was warned n ordered it anyways n lord was it spicy.

Amazing fried chicken sandwich. Fried catfish was great as well and the cheese, bacon, chive and sour cream grits were out of this world. Small space with a cool vibe. Happy hour starts at 1pm. Definitely coming back

OMG Peaches is delicious!!! Had the fried green tomatoes and almost fell off the chair from the tomato bacon yumminess!!!! Fried chicken is so good you'll never forget it! Mac and cheese is perfection and burgers cooked perfect to order! Love this place! Yum!! Must check it out for yourself!

Food is amazing. Place is small and cute. Very relaxed and laid back environment. Great music. A little tv over the bar. Great waiters m waitresses. I had the chicken n mac n cheese with the fried grits! I have nothing but great things to say. The sweet potato fries r the best ive tasted!! && you've got to try the hot sauce in that coca cola bottle ! Its not hott but has great flavor !

After hearing so many good things about Peaches HotHouse I decided to give it a try. There was a long line, but that doesn't bother me when I am expecting to try some bomb southern food. The food is just mediocre. I tried the extra hot chicken and it wasn't extremely hot at all. I was disappointed when my mouth wasn't feeling the burn. I expected a spicy chicken when they give you a warning about how spicy it. So if your looking forward to trying a spicy chicken, you will be disappointed when it's not at that level. I also ordered the spicy shrimp which was better, not overcooked.  The mashed potato was dry and no flavor. I'm confused why so many great reviews. Maybe it was my batch of chicken! Good luck if you try this restaurant. I would say keep searching ~ Cheers!!

Oh, Peaches - why are you so delicious? This place has the best fried chicken that I've ever had. It's the type of place where you take a bite of their food and you just shake your head, speechless, because it's just that good. I get the extra spicy hothouse chicken - I'd like to think that I handle my spicy pretty well and this one has a strong kick, but just enough to get your blood pumping. The chicken is tender, moist, and cooked to perfection. The skin is thin, crispy, and covered in that magical concoction of spices. Use the bbq sauce on the table - it's absolutely delicious and great for coating pieces of chicken for a cool down. The restaurant is packed at all hours, but well worth the wait. Just thinking about their chicken makes my mouth water - as a matter of fact, I'm going to head there now...

Love this spot. The best hot chicken ever! The only place I will eat grits at. They are in need of a bigger venue it gets so crowded and the wait can be very long. Have been wanting to come for brunch but considering how long the wait can be I keep passing and just come early for dinner.

Absolutely loved this place! Come early since its super popular and it fills up fast. Also the place is huge. The food was amazing and hugeee. For brunch it's well worth for sure.

I've come to Peaches on 4 separate occasions for brunch. They have a system where you write your name on a whiteboard in front so you can even see how many folks are ahead of you. My girlfriend and I have never had to wait more than 10-15 minutes. The drinks are clever and delicious and the food has always been great. I love the spicy chicken sandwich and the corn pancakes. The vibe is great here as well, they have dope music playing every time I come. It does take a while for the food but it's a small one room restaurant, the kitchen can't be but so big with so many people working. Be understandable and hungry, and come to leisure. My friend and I decided to check this place out after I had walked by one day and seen that it was pretty packed. I assumed the food would be fantastic, but I was wrong. We went in and ordered the BBQ shrimp and the fried green tomatoes as appetizers. They were both OK, but nothing too special. We went on to order our chicken and I decided to get the hot chicken and he got the Nashville hot chicken.... holy s*** was his chicken hot... I love spicy food but it can't JUST be spicy, there should be flavor as well, right? His chicken was so hot that it made my lips go numb and there was absolutely no flavor other than HOT. He had the cole slaw which I  practically finished in seconds just trying to make the hot go away. It helped but it would have been better if their coleslaw didn't taste like water. Now my chicken on the other hand was just hot chicken which was totally bearable but pretty disgusting. The chicken still had no flavor at all... the chicken skin had zero flavor as well.. just a little dash of some hot spice. I also had the macaroni and mashed potatoes which were pretty good surprisingly. The corn bread was super dry though. I had pretty much gulped my whole drink in a second after eating my friends chicken and once I  started eating the cornbread I  felt like I was going to choke.. you're definitely going to want to have a drink nearby when eating bread drier than Popeyes biscuits. Overall the experience was pretty crappy and the food was below average. We definitely won't be returning.

Went to Peaches HotHouse in Mother's Day for dinner with friends. Even though PHH is small, they were able to accommodate 8 of us. The food was so delicious! Used to be my wife and I favorite southern fried chicken Resturant, customer since 2009, but management has continued to cut costs over past 4 years constantly changing the menu, increasing prices, serving cold chicken, changing staff, removing traditional dishes from the menu, changing the drink menu, and lots more. This is one of my Bedstuy staples.  The fried chicken dinner is delicious and comes with a side and cornbread and yummy pickles.  The hot fried chicken is my favorite (it's always been spicy, flavorful, and juicy).  They switch up the side dishes based on season (I think) and I wish they'd bring back their baked beans and potato salad.  I think their mac & cheese is meh and I wish the cornbread servings were larger.  I highly recommend you go during off peak hours or do carry out because hardly any restaurant is worth a 1-2 hour + wait.

I am from New Orleans and have never had correctly made BBQ shrimp outside of that area. But Peaches is doing it right. The fried chicken sandwich was also super crispy and delicious.

Word of advice my dear Yelpers: go early. We went around 10am and snagged one of the last seat free. Egads! Food is pretty tasty, the biscuits are awesome and the overall vibe is pretty cool. The Bloody Mary was heavy on the Sriracha so not totally my fave, but definitely a spot to check out.

This place is the closest I've gotten to Southern food. I wouldn't know about the authenticity of the recipes, but everything was pretty good. My friend and I got the fried chicken with a side of mac and cheese and mashed potatoes. There are no problems with the food, but the service was okay. There was one guy that started out as our server. He asked if we could move to acommodate a bigger group, which was fine, but no one helped us move the drinks or bags. Then, we got a second server who requested the food and was very nice. Then, we had to wait for the original waiter to pass us our check.

This was the best food we had on our trip!  I'm from the south, and their grits were the best I've ever had. They were light and creamy goodness. We all shared our food and the favorite by far was the barbecue shrimp. We ended up dipping everything in the extra sauce, fried chicken, fried green tomatoes, everything. The fish sliders were very good. The fried green tomatoes were average. The service was friendly even though we had kids with us (sometimes we get the stink eye for bringing kids into trendy or small places, but not here). The sever initially forgot a beer we'd ordered. He remembered it after we got our food but took it off the bill because it was so late. It wasn't very crowded at lunchtime on a Friday but it's small so it could fill up fast. The prices are also very reasonable for New York. Will definitely come back!

3.5. Don't think about trying to do anything other than order out. Place is small and packed with huge waits. Crispy, spicy chicken did the job. Hot is HOT. I think the mac and cheese was the best side.

I am posting this review late (6 months), but a friend of mine reminded me that it needs to be posted. Peaches Hot House serves good food, but they have unprofessional management. My husband and I went to Peaches Hot house for Valentine's Day 2018. At the end of the meal, we gave our server two $25 gift cards ($50 total) that we received from our friends as a Christmas gift. The server came back to us and explained that, "Peaches card system was down and the manager was not present." I told the waitress to take our gift cards and contact me if there were any issues. Instead, she told me to put the meal on my personal credit card. I told her that it is not my fault that their card system is down and therefore not my responsibility to cover a meal that had previously been paid for via gift cards. Additionally, I was surprised there was no one present that was responsible enough to deal with the situation. She told me I had no other choice and I put the cost on my card (a mistake, I should have just left) and even tipped 19%. I wrote down the waitresses name and told her I would be coming back to get a refund. I came back a few days later and gave the manager my gift cards and the manager said I should expect a refund. I never received that refund and have been having to go back and forth to this restaurant to resolve the issue. By the end of my experience I had not only paid for a meal that I should not have ($60), but also lost my gift cards ($50), so in total I paid $110 for a $60 meal... I was never reimbursed on my credit card. Would be glad to show management. I feel like I've been robbed from this restaurant.

Crispy grits and fried chicken go perfect together. Between the perfectly crisp and not greasy chicken to the relaxed local atmosphere, I'll be making the ten minute walk from my apartment more often than my body would like.
My boyfriend and I took the recommendation to eat at Peaches...and it was probably the best recommendation ever. Their chicken sandwich really is the best anywhere. Wow.
fried chicken was good, a classic properly executed, moist and steamy inside but nothing to brag about it, nice woman behind the bar

Good was amazing, I had the chicken with mashed potatoes and macaroni and cheese. Buttttttt the restaurant is so tightly packed with people literally eating on top of each other that I couldn't enjoy my food at all. It just feels really uncomfortable... Great food though, just consider going at exactly 4pm when they open because any later it gets ridiculous.

I heard of this place through the grape vine and boy was this a good recommendation! Peaches Hothouse does not mess around with testing your ability to handle the heat. I got myself a chicken sandwich and it was fantastic. The bun is a bit underwhelming, but it does soak up all the juiciness of the chicken oils, so you end up eating everything off your plate.

The fried chicken was dry, probably because they over spice it. They were nice enough to make the fried chicken slightly more mild, but I don't' think it's particularly good in terms of flavor. Obviously, you'd disagree if you're the type that likes to burn off your taste buds.

Peaches Hothouse is heaven sent. The chicken is so good it makes you think about it all day. Don't think we haven't gotten it two days in a row, and please don't ask me about three! The bar is cozy and friendly, even if sometimes the bartenders don't give you the time of day. One of those absolute gems of a neighborhood spot!

I was in need for some good Southern food so I had in mind to call Peaches on Lewis Ave but I saw this place and realized I was closer. I called and spoke to a nice staff member that took my order which was catfish sliders, mashed potatoes and broccoli. The total was a bit pricy but my stomach was speaking waaay too much. Lol, anyway, the place is small and quaint, it felt like being in my living room. They also have a bar; it looks small but it's doable. The place has old but homely feel. If you don't care about decor, then you would really like it here. The wait was long but it was pretty full so I knew I would wait longer than 20 minutes. But eventually I got my dinner. The catfish sliders were spicy but it was a bit soggy and overcooked. The steamed broccoli and mashed potatoes were okay, nothing to complain about. I wasn't too impressed with my dinner but I would like to give this place another try so I may visit and actually sit in.

Fried chicken is my guilty pleasure and I love trying new places that are known for it. That being said, the fried chicken here is really good, flavorful and crispy! I loved it and would have given more stars if the waiter didn't give us the wrong order after we waited 3 hours to sit down and eat. Yes, you read it right. Three whole hours. Two hours of waiting for a table and then another hour of waiting for food. Despite that, I think I'll still come back again but maybe with less people (I had a party of 7) and at an earlier time.
Food was delicious.    Service was great.    Good vibes.     It's small so there was a wait but so worth it.
