Great food; prefect brunch spot in BK!  We love the food and the service was good. We sat on the patio to enjoy the beautiful day.  I highly recommend Hothouse for anyone who enjoys i taste of the south in the north.

What I like about this restaurant is that it has a limited menu and everything on that limited menu is made to perfection. You go to most restaurants now and the menu is so extensive that you've gotta wonder if the chef is good at making everything on the menu taste exactly how you want it. At any rate, his restaurant is small, maybe 10 tables, maybe not and it makes you feel like home. The bar seems a little large for the space, but who cares. Their adult drinks are delicious and you won't even notice. Eat here. You won't be disappointed. Oh, I almost forgot: I had the short rib sandwich, sweet potato fries and a side of Mac. Delicious. Someone else had the fried chicken, another had the shrimp and another had a burger, all with zero complaints. Yeah, eat here.

I feel like everyone knows the service is extremely hit or miss here but ...I went in for lunch and got fried chicken and the worst service in Brooklyn. I got there around 1:30PM on 7/20. Upon entering the space, the bartender was busy swiping credit cards and the server/busser/runner was doing maybe half of one of those jobs. I surveyed the space and was surprisingly greeted by one of the chefs. HE cleared a table for me, brought me a menu, took my order, got me my drinks, cooked my food AND ran it to my table. While this all happened, none of the front of house staff thought to figure out what was happening w my table (of 1). It wasn't until I put my headphones in to deafen the conversation being had at the bar between the bartender and his friends about his opinion of "fat" and "thick" women and what they should call themselves. (Very appropriate conversation to have while serving fried chicken, ok). All the while another woman was maybe a server or food runner was standing around, drinking her beverage and shouting with the bartenders guests about "white v black music"... the topic is irrelevant, reflective of what she seemingly thought of her job. She walked past my table multiple times, never went to ask if I would like a box for the remaining of my food that I no longer had an appetite to enjoy. At some point, you might assume someone having lunch by themselves would like to pay and leave, but these people must not want or need money. As someone who has worked in the industry for years, I would advise that if these people would like to make money in any capacity, they fix this lackadaisical and "too cool for school" attitude. Perhaps think beyond their offensive conversations, and reappropriate that energy towards the other ten tables filled with paying customers. For the service I received today, I could have gone to Popeyes and felt my fried chicken and disrespect would have been a steal of a deal.
This is a place you go to knowing why and are blown away for the why. I'm not someone who chases food fads in some cool neighborhood. This is the real deal !

I'm not going to complain about the wait at times because when something is good everyone wants it! I love the fried shrimp and mac & cheese they are my favorites for lunch/dinner. For breakfast I love the French toast and peach dressing served with it. It's absolutely amazing. It reminds me of my grandmother's peach cobbler. The place has a very cute ambiance, not too small definitely not big but always a great vibe.

Truly bad food. Fried chicken was gamey, tough and chewy. The spicy chicken sandwich was the same except it had an excessive amount of paprika on it. Not a nice blend of spices, or sauce, just straight up paprika. Excessively spicy and not flavorful at all. The fries were cold, week old McDonald's fries. Not even kidding, they served us old McDonald's fries. Mac and cheese was ok, but cold and burnt. Heard great things about this place so I was pretty disappointed with these shitty sandwiches. Go anywhere else for better fried chicken.

I visited this establishment last night and I must say the food is amazing. I ordered the Hothouse burger. The burger was so delicious and the fries were tasty as well. The place is really small but the food makes you forget about the size of the restaurant. I almost forgot l also ordered the bourbon butter cake and it was divine. I would definitely visit again because of the great food and customer service.

Since moving to Bed Stuy I have been here about 4-5 times so I feel I can give a honest review. This place is small and definitely not fancy but the food is so good and never had any issues with the service. I usually go on a week day to avoid the crowds because it can definitely be a wait on the weekend.  The fried chicken might be some of the best I have ever had, I have tried the Hot and Extra Hot. Now the Extra Hot and not for the faint of heart. I LOVE spicy food and even this was a bit much for me, Ive learned my lesson and will stick to the hot from now on. Did I mention the Mac and Cheese is Bomb??? Love the cocktails too. All and All I am a fan and will be here pretty regularly. Feel free to wave if you see me.
The HOT fry chicken was awesome! The butter bourbon cake was a sweet finish to delicious meal!
I havent been in a while  so I decided to go and yet again I wasn't disappointed I ordered extra hot chicken nice company food was delicious  drunk could have been better thou
No comment
Everything I've tried has been great, hot chicken is my favorite though. Cocktails are all fantastic and the service is wonderful despite how busy it gets.

Food is good but the waitlist situation is the absolute worst. Waitress sat a friend that wasn't on the list before people who had been waiting an hour. If you're a party of 3 expect for all of the 2 tops that arrive after you to be seated first (there's no pushing tables together).
No comment
Really good food, I came here with my friends, I do wish the sittings were a big bigger, very minimalist look, the food made up for it. I would come again. I wish there were half stars. lol
The food was delicious. I had a great time here with my family. The menu was very straight forward and had exactly what I wanted. The only criticism is that it is kinda a small space.
Tasty drinks, bomb mashed potatoes, friendly staff, lively vibe, but not the best fried chicken.

Because of the gentrification in Brooklyn, sometimes food isn't as spicy as some restaurants claim it to be. The hot chicken is definitely hot but not hot that all you can taste and feel is the burn from the pepper. It's been well seasoned, it's juicy and fresh, just everything you'd expect from the perfect piece of fried chicken. This might be a dark thing to say but idc lol. I'd have the hot chicken as my last meal on death row. ‍
No comment
Deliciousssss Hot Chicken!!! Enough said.
No comment
No comment

Ahhh soo good!!! Came here with a party of 4 just after 11am on a Saturday for brunch. We didn't have to wait long at all for a table, maybe 5-10 mins (though there was a line-up for sure by the time we were finishing up). The crispy shrimp sandwich was done so well. I got it in "hot" which was perfectly hot and so flavourful. Everyone loved their food and we couldn't stop talking about it the rest of our trip. Our server was also super friendly and attentive so thumbs up to her as well!
This place is faarrrr from me (I live in Harlem), but I've enjoyed the food here so much, I've made the trek out here a few times. I really enjoy their shrimp and grits and their fried chicken.
No comment
They really need to bring the meatloaf back. The extra hot is finally eatable :) perfect level of heat. But be warned it is intense. All the sides are the best we like the fried grits.
The food is magnificent, the staff take very good care of you. I love brunch at this Brooklyn hot spot. Its just peachy.
The food was AMAZING and the service was GREAT!  I can't wait to go here again!  The bourbon pound cake was an excellent touch after our dinner.  I'm still drooling...
No comment

Ok, I have A Baby Shower to attend in  Bk on Atlantic Ave, but before getting there I want to stop and get brunch, because like Marvin, I'm STARVING!!! I mess around and do so many other things and now it's getting LATE! Finally I make it to Brooklyn, chicken & Waffles are on my mind, since I'm not going to be to far, I figure I'll try Sweet Brooklyn bar and grill. Find parking around the corner, walk down the block and enter. There's A party going on. Ladies are singing, dancing and drinking to loud hip hop music the dj's playing. I wait to see if there's A hostess and will they approach me. After waiting about 10mins and nothing has happened, I notice the lady on the far side taking drink orders. I asked her can I sit somewhere and eat. She informed me the kitchen is closed, it's past 4PM. With that said, I leave and head towards another spot near by, I've read about. I arrive and I almost actually passed right by. If it wasn't for the people standing in front, I very well would've walked right by. I enter and it's Very tiny. Simple decor, nothing fancy, the bar occupies the majority of the room. I'm told to place my name on the board, brunch is over and @430 PM Dinner is beginning.  When my name is called, I'm offered A seat at said bar, I'm in A hurry, so I accept to sit there. Ordered the Fried chicken and mac and cheese as my side. The chicken was well cooked and tasted good. The mac and cheese was OK, cornbread which came with the meal, was very good. If you've read previous post of mines, you should know I like my food piping hot, this was not the case, the food wasn't cold, but it could've been slightly hotter. Overall I like the simplistic vibes and decor, you can tell, they are Basically about serving F00D and not worried about all the other ancillary stuff. I will like to come back and try brunch. Until then, I'll keep holding on.....3.5 star(S)

This is a little hidden gem in BK! It's small and tables fill up fast but we were able to get a table right around the peak of dinner. The menu was somewhat limited in terms of offerings but I had managed to find something to my liking. My choice was the chicken dinner with fried Brussels sprouts. The chicken was double fried so it was very crunchy and the meat was moist and juicy. Loved the sprouts although I would've added garlic and fried it in bacon grease (just saying). It came with corn cake (it was corn bread but it was sweeter than Jiffy cornbread and I'm not a fan of sweet bread). My daughter had the catfish and it was good, fried with cornmeal (not flour which is sacrilegious in my opinion LOL) with a side of french fries and cole slaw which was good as well. I would definitely come back again.
Be prepared to wait,this place has great southern cuisine and there is always a line to get in.Parking is not good but there are 2 buses that stop a block away.The food is worth the wait.

The place is small but the music is nice. I had the short rib sandwich with fries and a sweet Georgia brown. While I wished the meat had a little more flavor it was pretty good. It was tender and juicy. The drink was pretty good as well, it definitely packed an unexpected punch. The cornbread was also rather tasty. The mac and cheese was subpar, don't waste your money ordering that.

The food is amazing! Their chicken, shrimp speciality plates are the bomb! Location of the restaurant is a little shady(a lot of homeless, fights across the street,etc) however once inside the small, tiny, bitty restaurant the vibe is amazing! All of their workers have great customer service skills and treat everyone with respect! The waiting time for a party of 2 was approximately 15 minutes at around 7:30pm; however around 8pm the waitlist was longer. Yet many people waited outside the restaurant relaxed and chilled while they waited to be seated.
No comment
The place was very small and although the descriptions of the dishes read very appealing the actual food was not. I was disappointed.
No comment

Used to be a regular. The food is really good, but service is not. They asked us to wait, then told us they were no longer seating but we could order to go. Then didn't take our to go order for another 30 minutes so we left. Put a big damper on our night, we were so excited! Oh well...
Great food and excellent customer service. Our bartender/server, Hadass, was attentive, funny, and nice.
No comment

Please do yourself a favor and go have some fried chicken here if you haven't already. It's the best Tennessee hot fried chicken around. We've become regulars here on Saturday afternoons. The beer/beverage selections and cocktails are great. The service is efficient which is important given it's a tiny restaurant. There are very few seats in this place so they need to keep things moving..as they should. Don't linger at your seat after you're finished your meal!! Share the spicy chicken love. They typically have great music playing.
My entire head was sweating and my lips were numb when I got done with the extra spicy hot chicken. Needless to say I'll be back here again very soon. Fresh, hot, and crisp!
The food was ok. I was most dissatisfied with the service. The person who took my to go order was very rude when I had questions and the menu. Rude enough for me to not come back again.
No comment

DONT BOTHER!!!!  I have been eating here for more than 10 years, and the food and the vibe have been terrific; very casual and laid back.  I ate there tonight and the place looked different and the staff was all new. The prices were somewhat higher and the menu was severely limited.  The food tasted somewhat different.  It looks like new management or owners. I WONT BE BACK. It breaks my heart to lose this place that had great food and was a comfort zone.

This place is great, it's usually full when we come so my husband I usually eat at the bar. The wait staff & bartenders are always friendly. And the food...the spicy fried chicken is amazing! This is good southern food, the sides stand on their own as well. We've been coming here for quite a few years and have never been disappointed.

I've been waiting weeks to try this place and I really wanted to love it but I just didn't. The place is fairly small so I understand the wait to be seated. However, the service is slow and the food was not that great. The fried chicken was nice and spicy just the way I like it but I couldn't finish the sides. The kale tasted sour, the macaroni and cheese was dry and the grits were bland. Pretty overpriced for comfort food too.
No comment

Tuesday afternoon, I ordered a chicken sandwich to go. I was super annoyed at how long it took....about 35 mins or more. There was only 1 server who was taking care of the whole dining room, diners at the bar AND outdoor diners. S/O to her, she def held it down. When I got home, my sandwich was AMAZING. They packed the coleslaw and sauce on the side which kept the bun from getting soggy. The chicken was still crispy but so juicy on the inside. Hands down best chicken sandwich I've ever had!  Definitely worth the wait.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Small but great southern food with a bit of New Orleans flavor. Shrimp and grits was as good as I've had down south. Warning-the hot fried chicken is really hot, so take care. Good beer and cocktail choices at reasonable prices by NYC standards ambiance pretty bare bones, but good service.
No comment
No comment

I came to this location based on my previous experiences at Peaches located on Lewis Street. My bridal party and I decided to have brunch here at 10am when the restaurant opened. My party was a total of 8 people. The food was great, however the service was poor. Our waitress refused to accommodate our party and made us sit at different tables. The disappointing part was that I called the previous day and was informed that they did not take reservations . I was told to walk in and the restaurant will accommodate my party. The waitress was rude  and I would not return due to the service.

OMG! The food is amazing! Good vibes! Whom ever created the "Big Jim Cade Style" dish is a genius! Flavored fried chicken with granola crusted french toast--- AMAZING!!! The establishment is small but spacious. You don't feel confined by the table arrangement. Good music. Prompt table service! Definitely my new spot!
No comment

The sides were all a little over room temp but the chicken was nothing short of amazing  I had the regular with a side of mac, tried the collared greens as well as the mashed potatoes, they were all good but again a little over room temp. The chicken was super soft and juicy on the inside , crunchy on the out, and the hot sauce mixture on the table was amazing ! Would def come back overall

The yelp review for peaches hothouse will confuse new customers. We went to peaches hothouse and saw that the menu did not have fried chicken. The server explained that peaches about 7mins away is the location that serves fried chicken. Peaches hothouse does not. The menu did look good and the service was still pleasant but I am not a seafood/fish person so the only thing that stood out for me was the turkey meatloaf but since we were in need of fried chicken, Mac, and greens we didn't stay. The two restaurants are affiliated but do not go to peaches hothouse looking for catfish sliders and fried chicken because peaches is the location that actually serves these options.
No comment

Like other reviewers stated, the line is incredibly long, so be prepared to wait. The food was decent, maybe because I'm from the south, I expected a bit more. I got the chicken dinner with creamy grits. The chicken was well seasoned and nicely fried. I thought the creamy grits would've had cheese since I saw a lot of the other patrons with cheese on their grits, but I guess you had to ask. It was just really busy and overcrowded.
Let's face it - it's Peaches but in a more intimate, smaller setting. The fried chicken sandwich is incredible. Don't forget to write your name on the waiting list by the door when you walk in.
Love, love, love their food. The French toast and peaches. Omg! And the cheese grits are the best I've ever had!!!
I frequent this place. Love their po boy sandwiches. U must try the sweet potato fries, come back on a weekend for brunch and try the french toast and hot peaches yum :-)

Have to agree with everyone else here complaining about the decline in quality here. I used to love coming here and ordering the shrimp sandwich. Being from the South, it's hard to find good soul food like this. What used to be amazing crispy shrimp on a grilled roll with lettuce is now more expensive, but they offer less. It's essentially just shrimp on dry bread, which is really depressing to find when you order it to-go. Wtf, also when you consider that the alternative is waiting in line for 40 mins to get a table
No comment

One of the places that I love to frequent on my annual trip to NY.  The fried chicken is always great.  They advertise "hot" and it is truly that!  Moist and succulent, it's always worth the flight and train ride down.

Man I'm honestly kind of bummed, I used to come here all the time to either dine in house or grab something to go since we live down the street. Great food, great service, and always a solid good time. However the past two times the food just hasn't been on par. We got take out the first time and ordered some chicken sandwiches which are usually a go to and let's put it this way, I don't know what happened but the chicken was so thin that it might as well have just been all skin and fried parts. We thought that it may have just been a one time deal but we stopped in there for brunch - same thing again... This saddens me because the service there is pretty great and the staff are always kind, but I sure as hell think fried chicken should have actual chicken in it. Hope this changes soon...
No comment
No comment
Went here for brunch during the summer. The place is very hip and garners a nice crowd, but the grits and fish option was not lasty. Wouldn't go back for brunch.
No comment
No comment

Amazing food! Great atmosphere! And wonderful waitress staff. My mother and I had brunch here today and it is all the rave! The chicken is as I joked with mom "slap ya momma good".  The spicy chicken was just the right amount of spice, juicy and so crunchy. The veggies cooked to prefection kale and asparagus. The bbq and fried grits, oh my just amazing. How do they fry grits into cheese succulent cubes of deliciousness. The French Toast oh yummers I can't even explain. Just go a see for yourself. You won't be disappointed!
No comment

It lives up to the hype,  chicken is moist not bland, definitely worth the try.  I actually prefer the chicken sandwich with slaw and some sort of delicious homemade sauce (mayo based but didn't taste like it such is good cause I'm not a fan of mayo). Mac n cheese was decent but changes day to day. Very small inside, no place to wait except outside, so if it's freezing hopefully you brought a car to go sit in.

Came here for the second time on Sunday evening and I was reminded why this spot is so dope! It's So Brooklyn (My Brooklyn People know what I'm talking about)! I had the Hot Chicken (you get three options for spiciness) Tasty Flavorful Chicken, Delicious Cheesy Mac and Cheese, Bomb Corn Bread and Even Dope Signature Cocktails! On top of that it's quaint enough to hear someone across the table or at the bar even with the nice flow of people traffic. Well be heading back to Peaches HotHouse Sooner than later! Get Involved!
No comment
No comment
Love this place, a BedStuy must try. The hot chicken is like really hot, start with the mild!
No comment
No comment
Don't know how the food is, canceled my order after it was an hour late and apparently hadn't left the restaurant.

Waited 1.5 hrs for a table and then decided to get our dinner as take out...waited another 45 min for food. Total disappointment..french fries and asparagus looked as though they were leftovers from a different diners plate and the heavily cayenne peppered fried chicken and shrimp were stone cold...coleslaw may have been spoiled, we will see if my husband gets sick. I was too scared to try it. This is not the Nashville we remember. Try harder Peaches!
Good service and great fried chicken!  Be prepared to wait.  It's a popular spot and very small.
No comment

French toast, bacon, creamy grits! Seriously delicious. Every bite was amazing! The service was just ok and the wait was pretty long but the food made up for most of that! I will definitely visit here again when I am in New York! Yum!!!!
Peaches has changed... Everything used to be tasty but the recipes have changed and the food is bland at best. Service has gotten a lot worse too. Get it together, Peaches!
Great food! The chicken was amazing, I ordered all white meat. The services was terrible. The 3 waiters talked instead of cleaning the tables and seating guest.
No comment
No comment
No comment

Meek was our bartender/server he was super sweet,super attentive and cool. Food was amazing ,I got the Nashville supper hot fried chicken was super spicy but great, dope collard greens. I had a great experience.

Long overdue review...the best fried chicken and very kind service! Everyone I've recommended this place to also loves it. Also, they have two locations now, one in Bed Stuy and another in Fort Greene. The location in Fort Greene is larger and located where the Smoke Joint used to be.

If you like fried & spicy, this is the place for you!!!!! We ordered hot fried chicken & hot fried shrimp which came with collared greens and macncheese as sides. The chicken skin was perfect amount of crispy and flavor. Shrimp was ON POIINNTTTTTTTTT! The dipping sauce was bomb dot commmm!! Highly recommend!
No comment
What a gem!!! Great place, cool vibe. Portions are generous. Don't worry about the wait, it's worth it!

The Acadia scramble had flavor above and beyond what I expected! Get the collard greens, they're just a little spicy. I'm huge on breakfast, and this place is very much a cut above for your first meal!

I spent a wonderful Sunday afternoon here with my son and best friend. Let's start off by saying the hosts were very polite & welcoming. The food was also amazing. The only reason I took off a star was because I was so hot while sitting inside. Granted it is the middle of July lol but that was the only thing that gave me discomfort. Otherwise I highly recommend this restaurant and I'm looking forward to trying the brunch on Sunday morning
No comment
No comment
No comment

Much like Peaches, fantastic value for the kind of food you are served. I've gotten many things on the menu, my roommates and I frequent this place for happy hour dinner, and everything so far is top notch. But now that I've had the hot chicken sandwich, I will only eat the hot chicken sandwich. Also, at $6 their wedge salad will feed two people. The place is small and it fills up fast for happy hour AND brunch. I've gone twice for brunch and had to decline because of the wait. One day I'll get it, ha!

Great and friendly service. Went in on. Monday night an hour before closing and they were still very accommodating. I got the fried shrimp sandwich and it was so good! Stuffed with a generous portion of large-sized shrimp. The fries were really good too. My boyfriend and his brother (who are big eaters) got the fried chicken and were stuffed afterwards. Good cornbread too! Definitely going back!
No comment
Got a regular hot chicken w/ bacon tomato salad and an extra side of Mac and cheese. Everything was so good!!! I will be back :)

Small but friendly neighborhood restaurant! Collard and Garlic kale were good and the chicken sandwich was on point ! It is not a place to set down and have a lengthy meal , but a place to grab and go due to the limited seating! Well worth the trip

The food was good. My 1st time eating fried grits and I must say it was surprisingly good with the bbq shrimp. The place is really small n not to pleasing of having ur table so close to each other that there  is no privacy or space to really enjoy the place. However the food is good. Just wish place was larger.
No comment
No comment
No comment

A very cozy spot so you have to get their early as space is limited and the wait times are usually long. staff is friendly but let me tell you about the food! You have to get the fried chicken special with the macaroni and cheese. Not to mention the drinks!! So glad this is in my neighborhood as I will be back quite frequently.

Being from Tennessee, I am a sucker for Southern Fried chicken - especially hot chicken. This chicken was AMAZING. Juicy, hot, spicy, and crunchy....my mouth is watering while I'm writing this review. My boyfriend and I ordered the the chicken plates with sides. Their macaroni and cheese is great along with their mason jar cocktails. Service was prompt and efficient, especially for being pretty crowded. We will definitely be back soon.

Looove this place. Cocktails are on point, food is so so good and I want to try everything on their menu! Too bad the location is bit iffy and it's somewhat a trek to get to from the train, otherwise I'd be here all the time.
This place is sooo good ! Cocktails on point. Ribs on point. Greens on FLEEK! Black folk are beautiful
No comment
No comment
No comment
Some of the best fried chicken I've ever eaten.  *  And the Bacon-Potatoes Salad was to die for.  *  Endless  of all the Southern comfort food you can gobble up.

The chicken. Man o man the chicken. It's absolutely hands down the best fried chicken I've ever tasted outside of my home. It truly has that homemade taste that you often don't find at restaurants that gives it that extra umph of deliciousness. I've tried just about everything on the menu and don't really have any complaints. I live right around the corner and I'll honestly say my family and I developed a habit of frequently multiple times a week! Yes it's that good. The wait time can be a bugger when you're hungry and want to eat but it's worth the wait. The staff are so friendly and welcoming, they know my family every time we visit. During warm weather be prepared to wait even in the rain people will wait outside. Hopefully they will expand so they could seat more people, I know everyone would love that!
No comment

The lines on the weekend are SUPER LOOONG my suggestion is to call ahead your order on the weekend, if you want to skip the lines. The hot chicken is HOT. Good chicken. I've been back 3 times already!
No comment
No comment

It's really nothing to complain about when it comes to the food. Peaches is well known for their amazing so food and diverse dishes. the waiting staff is great and the places very well kept. My only complaint, is the size of the restaurant for the volume of people they get. I know it's petty, but it's always a long wait. For good reason, I understand. Overall a great place to go grab a bite.

I wanted to take my girlfriend to brunch on Sunday and hadn't really decided on a place to go. I happened to stumble upon Peaches Hot House and figured we should give it a try and let me just say that I am soooo glad that we did. We waited about an hr (as this place does not take reservations which is a bit annoying) but it was DEFINITELY worth the wait. We both had the sweet tea which was not to sweet and not to tart. She ordered the hot fried shrimp (which could be ordered as regular, hot or extra hot) and grits. We asked our waiter on a scale of 1-10 how hot the hot was and he said between a 6-7 which was NOT the case. Let me preface this by stating that my girlfriend is Trinidadian (born and raised) and is very well accustomed with hot/spicy food and this  was beyond hot; so if you do not like hot food like myself I strongly suggest that you get the regular. She did however finish her entire plate as the food was AMAZING but did mention a plethora of times that her mouth and lips were on fire. I ordered the Jim Cade brunch which included boneless fried chicken breast, granola crusted French toast, grits and eggs (which ii substituted for collard greens as I do not eat eggs). My order was delicious to say the least. The only reason I gave it 4 stars as opposed to 5 is because the spot was on the small side, you could not make reservations, and hot was on the extra hot side (which should be noted) other than that we will be back again!

Came here tonight with my boyfriend and immediately noticed the customers used tissues on the floor  as well as their crumbs. We weren't greeted and waited about five minutes  for someone to say "you may sit where ever you like." Our waiter sucked! She didn't seem to be knowledgable of the menu. Nonetheless, the food is Great! It just needs better service.

The food is okay, the wait was about 2 hours but it was a Friday night. I got the shredded beef short ribs sandwich and it was a little dry so I couldn't finish it. On the side I wanted asparagus and the asparagus wasn't seasoned so it was bland. Not worth the wait.

Food is good overall considering it's a southern food place in the north. Shrimp sandwich is my favorite here, the fries are bland though. Could use some Cajun seasoning. Customer service sucks. Every waiter is rude, ignores you and steps on your foot (literally), without apologizing. I would only get take out from here considering the bad service.

Stayed in an Airbnb near Peaches and used it as our go to place. Happy hour House special cocktail was delicious for a balmy March evening. The sparkling wine served in a plastic glass was a disappointment. The water is served in glasses, wine deserves similar treatment. The shrimp burger was massive and delicious. Kale Cesar salad was enhanced by the wonderful dressing and house made croutons. I would suggest not using plastic containers for salad dressing when people are dining in. Our server the first time was inattentive. We had to search out other servers to address our needs. The second night the server was on top of things. Just a few tweaks and it could be 5 star.
No comment

column3: Town of Oyster Bay, Long Island, NY
column6: Great food, the extra hot is infact extra hot and i have a very high spice tolerance but that chickens leaves a tingling burning sensation on your lips but soooo goood, the cole slaw was good and tasty and not to maynaisey, the garlic kale was amazinggg, mac n cheese was good, only giving it 4 stars because service wasnt the best but the staff was very friendly and polite but the place got so busy hard to keep up with everyone i guess.

Been twice and the food experiences were night and day. The first time everything was so great, and the next the mac was off, the chicken was lack luster. Cool spot, pretty cramped. Better than the other location on lewis.

Food presentation was wonderful however it was bland and unseasoned. Grits weren't cooked thoroughly and the cheese used in them reminded of traditional Mac n cheese (not velveeta). The French toast was doughy! Frustrating to chew! And the turkey bacon was tough as all get out! The highlight though was the shrimp ! The shrimp was AMAZING !!!!! So maybe if we ever go back just get the shrimp and grits! And pray the grits is cooked properly!
Food was great small place but loved the food. Everything was good. Mac and cheese was a little on the salty side.
Sister Rosetta is my favorite!!  The shrimp and fried chicken are the best!   Definitely a Brooklyn staple!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Fried Chicken was awesome .. Mac and Cheese was to die for .. Bartender was cool as hell .. Waitress was sweet .. Only thing I would change was the collard greens need more seasoning .. Otherwise it was great meal .. I'll def be coming back ..
Awesome shrimp sandwich but horrible grits and not a brunch place . I had the fried chicken with French toast combo and the grits were burnt and chicken was super hard .
Small restaurant, yummy food, friendly staff! Be prepared to wait :). We ordered Hot fried chicken with collards and mac n' cheese!

How can I keep calm and write this review ???? This is hands down one of my favorite places in NYC . I be been here countless times and at one point was going 2 times a week(I live borderline Long Island ). I'm gonna tell you right now I have no cons for this place whatsoever. This restaurant has a rustic feel  in a nice , cozy , intimate setting. There is always good music rotating on the sound system, great southern comfort food flying out the kitchen, and awesome flavorful drinks to wash it all down with. Im a big fan of the shrimp with creamy grits!! JESUS!!!!!!!!!!! I always get a side of chicken too. It's heaven on a plate. My drinks of choice are normally the sister Rosetta and the lighting Hopkins . I'm just a slave to this place!!. They are known for their "hot " specialty spice. The cuisine is Tennessee inspired dishes. I've converted my mom and brother. All staff are nice and great for conversations if you are sitting at the bar. Try this place you will not be disappointed!!!

I have heard so many good reviews about this place and was eager to eat here well to my surprise the service sucked and the food was just ok. The waitress messed up my order and attempted to tell me what I ordered; why are you debating with a customer? My friend and I also ordered appetizers and not only did we get it late, it was piping hot! The BBQ shrimp and grits was covered in a BBQ soup! It was literally enough BBQ sauce to drink and there was no turning those lemons into lemonade, hunty! LOL, but seriously the service was no laughing matter. My friend ordered the fried chicken and said, "it don't taste like mama's" which is code for hot sauce can't save this chicken. Let's have a moment of silence for all the fried chicken that didn't make it.  My friend did enjoy her drink!

What a wonderful place! The extra spicy chicken is one of those dishes hot enough it takes a certain athleticism to eat it, but, unlike many other incredibly spicy dishes around town, this one is so delicious I want to go back as often as possible. The sides I've had are all excellent and the drinks are magnificent. Everybody who works there creates a welcoming vibe and everybody who eats there abides and makes the place feel extra friendly. There are plenty of joints in New York that are fussier about their food but Peaches Hothouse is one of my favorite restaurants in the entire city!

I used to really dig this place when it first opened for business but Peaches HotHouse may have just lost me as a customer after what I experienced today. Cold food, loose, lumpy grits and scatterbrained waitresses who didn't take our orders until almost 20 minutes after we were seated. The lipstick stains on our drinking glasses were a HUGE 'minus.' Peaches HotHouse needs to worry less about crowd control & more about good service. This restaurant is smaller than most of the apartments in The Stuy. How hard can it be to run it properly?

My friends and I were craving Nashville-style hot chicken and we couldn't take a casual trip down to Nashville so Peaches HotHouse was the next best option. I would say that their hot chicken spice level is on the more conservative side. Consequently, if you like your chicken with some extra heat, going for the hot or even extra hot should satiate your palette. You also can't go wrong with any of the sides. The fried green tomatoes were divine. Highly recommend it for someone who has never tried Nashville-style hot chicken or for those of you who miss it.

Amazing fried chicken, maybe the best I've ever had. The spiciest is extremely tasty (though it does appear to vary in intensity from day to day) and at it's strongest is sweat-on-brow, heavy breathing inducing hot. Not like those other bullshit places that say hot but it's really just Frank's (c'mon like anyone believes that's spicy??). very friendly staff, can get a little crowded around dinner time and weekends, but hey what popular place doesn't? Make sure you go to the right one cause the other Peaches doesn't have fried chicken (though it does have a variety of more upscale food, which is also very good...just not the chicken). Go try the spiciest chicken and the arugula salad.
Wish the menu had a bit more options, I usually get the fries and the shrimp or fried chicken, pretty good. The chicken come in 3 different heats, regular, hot and Extremely Hot.

I used to live a few blocks from this place and would come here a lot. The food is phenomenal! i'd get the fried green tomatoes, chicken sandwich and boy was it good, i'm dreaming about it now. I had to give it one star because every time I went I would have crazy bad stomach problems after eating, every time! but its worth it.
The extra hot fried chicken was excellent and the cocktail menu rocks!! It seems like it's always slammed for dinner on the weekends so be prepared to wait. It's worth it imo

Finally got a chance to try this place out. Ordered the extra hot fried chicken with mac and cheese. The Extra Hot Fried Chicken was indeed EXTRA HOT like BEYOND SPICY yet SO GOOD ! Was very crispy, nicely portioned and better than i expected. The mac and cheese however was DISGUSTING. Extremely mushy and tasted like it had a hint of cinnamon in it. I only ate it to lighten up the spiciness from the chicken. All in all I will be back but I'll go for the regular hot fried chicken and a different side.

I can here with some coworkers a couple of weeks ago and the service stared off great. We were a large group and the waitress was extremely attentive. However, once people began to leave, a couple of us (3 in total) stayed behind to continue drinking and eating. The restaurant itself was EMPTY (which is saying a lot because the place is already small). Anyway while we sat chit chatting, our original waitress came over and proceeded to separate our tables as if we weren't sitting right there in the middle of a conversation. No excuse me or this is what I'm doing. Side eye and how rude! We of course put the tables back because we were still drinking and planning to order more food. Then another waiter came and attempted to separate us again telling us to sit at the bar. After going back and forth with him, I'm assuming the manager came over. She then justified us not sitting at the tables, and told us to move to the bar because they needed to prepare the tables for the dinner customers. So I'll say this again... the restaurant was EMPTY! If any dinner customers were coming in there were plenty of available tables for them to sit at. Plus we were still ordering food and drinks! All I saw was an incompetent manager mistreat existing customers all on the premise that other people "may" come. It was a disgusting display of management, poor etiquette, failure to acknowledge existing customers, and full on incompetence. I would never return nor would I recommend this place to anyone else. I also should have paid attention to other people's reviews because apparently they fail to get many things right.

I was really hyped up, I knew about the world renounce chef, I seen and read all the reviews. The food was underwhelming. The wait made it so we were unable to eat in so we took our food to go. The hour wait was just a little too much. I didn't mind the wait but I was hungry. It was a 27min drive from the restaurant to my home. The chicken was cold. Not warm or lukewarm, cold like cold cold, but it still tasted good. The corn bread was dry and bland. The grits could have used more salt but that's all preference. Not sure how the creamed spinach was made but has a slight off putting taste to it. The Mac and Cheese was okay, comparable to Chick-fil-a not sure if that's saying much. Even though the food wasn't what I expected and pretty high in price. The service was A1 so nice and welcoming. We didn't even eat there and we were impressed. Maybe was just came on an off night but it really didn't live up to the hype.

I came in to this restaurant excited to try there fired chicken the food came out at a decent time. However the meal was absolutely horrible and when I asked the manager if he could take it off the bill because I hadn't touch my food he refused to do so. He told me he would discount it I was fine with that only to find out that he only took off $15 from a $75 bill which still came out to me paying for the entire meal. The manager left me being unhappy he didn't seem to care at all if I was happy or not. I don't recommend this place.

Came here because the regular Peaches was closed due to an emergency. Came  on a double date for brunch on a Saturday. I had the hot fried chicken with the potato salad . Personally, I didn't like the Potato salad. I was expecting small pieces of potato but the potato pieces were quite large. The chicken is actually mediocre . Yes it's hot and spicy but it's not due to the seasoning. They just sprinkle cayenne pepper AFTER the chicken has been fried. So I bite into my chicken and I have a sneeze fest because the cayenne pepper is ALL OVER . That's lazy cooking if you ask me. On the other hand, the drinks were very very good. The place is super tiny and only has about 8 tables. Wouldn't go back .

I love this place on the normal, but they are fairly inconsistent when it comes to quality level of the food. Up until recently this was my go-to neighborhood spot. I think "what you get" is determined by the mood of the staff on that particular shift. I placed a to go order on the night of July 9th and we waited over 45 minutes even while the restaurant was fairly empty toward closing time. Not to mentioned we had to flag someone down to take our initial order. The server and staff we had were preoccupied with everything but customer service. We had to go in to retrieve our food and found out that it had been sitting there for some time. They offered a piece of fried chicken as a peace offering, but I think by then we were checked out. We opened the food at home and it was cold, with some items being undercooked. Again, I'm a fan usually, but this left a negative impression. Please work on consistency and it could make a huge difference.

If there is a line to enter, you have to put your name on the bulletin board.  Cute idea.  I had the regular fried chicken, mac & cheese, collard greens with a side of potato salad.  The chicken was good, but not enough to make me go out of way to come back.  After hearing someone on my job rave about it, I was disappointed.  The mac and cheese was good, but the collard greens had a bit too much vinegar and very spicy.  The potato salad was ok.  The service was good and efficient.  I was surprise by how small it is with just a seat for two in the doorway.  If you go when it is cold outside, which I did and your table is near the door, keep a scarf close by as there is nothing blocking the air as customers come and go.  They use a air of drapes to either try and hold back some of the cold.

I'm new to the neighborhood and looking for something to eat with my husband. We stumbled on this little hole in the wall. It's about 10:35pm at this time. We parked and walked into a calm small space, upon entry there was no acknowledgement. We grabbed a menu and looked at it. We laughed a little about the chicken being "too spicy" & decided to give it a go. At this point a few mins have passed and still no one even greeted us. The servers a male & female continue to move around busily & the bartender having a fruitful conversation with a gentleman continue to ignore us. I tried to get the servers attention and was ignored. A few mins later the bartender walks over with a serious face & blurts out "you want to order" & then a the male server hops out of no where and pins in "To Go" so my husband responded with "we were trying to dine in" the male server with an attitude repeats "to go". At this point I no longer felt welcome here & lost my appetite so I asked my husband to leave. I told the male server it's unprofessional the way you're running your business. You're rude and need a different approach. Being rude and chasing patrons out of your restaurant isn't a way to run a business. When we got outside of the restaurant the male server followed us out to point out on the door that they closed at 11pm. My husband and I was then attacked verbally by the male server, the MANAGER who was sitting outside having a smoke & 2 other men who came out of the restaurant behind us. ( BTW the MANAGER told us to mind our own business when I told the server he's rude & needs to learn how to speak to his customers properly & not rude. Instead of standing there repeating "To Go" say "I'm sorry we're about to close in a few but if you'd like we can wrap it up to go would have worked more effectively") Never again will I attempt to go here or recommend this place.  My first and hopefully my last NEGATIVE review. Thanks  Peaches Pothouse it was another great NY Experience

I ventured all the way out to Bed-Sty to get some Nashville style hot chicken and it was definitely worth it. I LOVE Nashville hot chicken but really haven't found anything as good outside of Tennessee. I'm pretty sure this is as good as it gets in New York City. To start, I recommend the barbecue shrimp. While they weren't amazing, they were quite delicious. I really liked the corn bread that it came with. Their specialty whiskey cocktails are also unbelievably good. To eat, you have to get the hot chicken. They can do it all white meat too if you ask! I got it hot and my fiance got it extra hot. The hot was hot enough for me and he was suffering a bit with the extra hot but it's definitely not too hot to handle. It comes with a side and I loved the mac & cheese. It also comes with delicious cornbread. The service here is great. However, be prepared to be smushed as they certainly pack in as many chairs and tables as can fit. On a Sunday evening for dinner, it was packed but we only waited a few minutes for a table. I'm sure this place is a madhouse for dinner. They don't take reservations.

Unfortunately the service was horrible! Server took forever to take food order, didnt check up on us for any service issue and drinks to WAY TOOO LONG to come!

Ordered the fried chicken with a side of mash/gravy and mac. Portions are perfect, chicken is delicious, the sides are good, and the staff is super friendly. Came at the perfect time during the weekend before the crowd came. Expect a wait but worthwhile.

A-maz-ing. AMAZING! the chicken is out of this world. And the pickles are great. I love pickles so pickles are very important to me. The catfish nuggets were also bomb. I love the whole atmosphere of this place. The regulars are so friendly and chill and it's just a great vibe. The cocktails and beer options are a bit lackluster but when the food is so good it hardly matters at all. Come here. ASAP.

Tricky because the food is so good but the service... placed a food and drink order at the bar a bit before last call. Drinks took quite a bit. As we checked on the status after an extended wait the bartender, Karli, who took our order said the other bartender, let's call her #2 (brownskin, petite, short curly cut), who moved at a snails pace would be fulfilling our order. When our to go food arrived we prepared to eat it at the bar when we heard audible sighs and saw eye rolling from bartender #2. Proactively, I asked if we weren't welcomed to eat at the bar, as she said "actually, no you have to leave, you're not a dine in order", although we were still waiting to finish the drinks that finally arrived. The two bartenders proceeded to vocalize their frustrations behind the bar and in earshot of my friend and I.  "They know the policy" Karli said. After making them both aware that we could hear their conversation and expressing my discontent with their lack of professionalism both rolled their eyes and sighed at our complaints. Very disappointing considering this is one for the few options and one of my favorite places to eat in Bedstuy. I do hope that it this gets to a leader, they will appropriately correct these behaviors and to the lack of a client-centric service mentality.

When a majority time vegetarian can't resist trying the chicken at a chicken place, you know something is being done RIGHT. Also- you can make a plate out of the sides alone. A++ to the collards, garlic sauteed broccoli, mashed potatoes, and cornbread.

I heard they had a burger with a fried chicken patty on top of the burger. It's called the Booker T Burger (which was PERFECT - add some hot sauce on it), and got a side of Creamy Grits (also good). The service was nice, food prep was a bit slow... but the food was so good, who cares?!

The menu isn't for everyone but I love it! Nothing beats homemade Grits. Granola crusted French toast is delicious.

Fried chicken to die for, obviously. And an absolutely gorgeous cassoulet. I also appreciated that they let me have a table to myself while I waited for my friend to show up, but then again, it was a Sunday night.

I've been to peaches quite a few times, and the food is delicious. I have to warn you though... The place is very small. Peaches is southern soul food.... They specialize in their fried chicken which is delicious. My favorite side has to be the Mac & Cheese. My friend had the chicken po' boy, and he really enjoyed it... So much that he vows to go back to have it again. The drinks have to be my favorite though. Their specialty cocktails are all delicious. My favorite has to be the sister Rosetta. Since the place is tiny, I'd recommend bringing a date here or a group of 2 or 3 tops.on any given night you should expect a wait, even though it may be a short one. The service was great though.
The hot chicken is amazing but the restaurant is really small and tight, gets crowded fast  so it's not the most comfortable dine in environment

The food is very good overall here, the only reason I took away one star is because there is usually a significant wait for a table (no option for mAking reservations ahead). Also it's a bit too cramped for space. Nevertheless I've been here many times and will probably keep going back Cz the good is usually worth it.

If you're from the south(to a New Yorker thats anything below them) and want some soul food, then this is about as close as you're going to get. Now its not your grandmas chicken, greens, mac and cheese but its not bad for a NY'er. It's a small setting but it doesn't take too long to get seated. I almost forgot, the Spicy isn't Spicy. So go ahead and take the plunge if you're on the fence.

I really want to take off a star because of my last visit. I've had a few really good meals here so I was disappointed (and embarrassed) by the subpar food at my most recent visit. I had an amazing catfish dinner there after the New Year. It took me back to my childhood in Memphis, it was so amazing. On this recommendation my family found ourselves at The Hothouse for a birthday dinner. My sister got the catfish and collard greens. I haven't eaten collard greens out in forever but, I had to have a taste. PH delivered on the flavor, the greens are right.  But, my sister said not so the catfish. I didn't taste it but, I don't doubt it. I had the fried chicken and mac. Again the side was delightful but, the meat was missing something. I ordered mild but, fried chicken shouldn't need spicy spices to be flavorful. I expect all my chicken fried to finger lickin' goodness. The service was great as was dessert. Lastly my nieces French fries were not fresh and she barely ate them. I love all fries, even bad, so her plate didn't reflect her displeasure but . . . they made a sad showing for fried potatoes. What was consistent was the service and the beverages. The host and waitstaff almost made up for the off night in the kitchen. Of course everyone has off days; all is forgiven.  I can't wait till my next visit, I'm going to get my chicken with some spice and the greens as an extra side.

The atmosphere was great and you couldn't ask for more. I will be going back very soon.

No comment

THIS PLACE IS TOTALLY OVERRATED. Now with that said, there wasn't anything particularly bad about this place it just wasn't good. It was my girlfriend and I first time here so we walked into the restaurant and was confused as to who works there and what to do. There is a board right outside of the door that you're supposed to sign your name on, fine. The wait was 45 minutes and I think with a wait that long there should be someone offering menus so that you can at least have a drink while waiting but no one did. We got drinks anyway. The sparkling wine was great and the other drinks were okay.  My girlfriend and I had the fried chicken and mac and cheese, cole slaw and grits. The chicken came with cornbread that had the flavor of cake and the texture of really stale cake, no good. The sides were okay but our favorite was the cole slaw everything else was one note. As for the fried chicken...whomp whomp, seriously! The crispy coating on the outside was great but then you get to the meat and it is just bland. I mean BLAND. There wasn't even a slight taste of salt, good lord! I mean look, it's cute and cheap but I wouldn't even eat any of those items again. Is it a dead end for me? No but I probably wont be coming back anytime soon nor can I give the word of mouth to come here. Nope, not from me.
No comment
No comment
Meatloaf wasn't the best but the atmosphere, deserts and pork where all excellent! Lemonade is not home made which was surprising because the vibe of the place makes you think it would be.
No comment
No comment
The best food !!!! They have the best mash potatoes at an adorable price. I love the setting and atmosphere as well. I would recommend anybody to this place.

Delicious chicken. The wait was terrible though. I have to say, if you go to a good fast-food chinese place you might find this type of chicken. The difference is in the flavor and how toasted is the skin. Overall, its a restaurant that deserves to be tried once.

Just discovered the burgers. Omg bacon, Swiss cheese, fried green tomato and it was big and juicy and scrumptious. I can still taste it. I love sitting in the sun outdoors, but probably could have drank more if served inside.

WOW! kick ass fried chicken! love it! lost a star only b/c the mac and cheese was a little disappointing and the other sides paled in comparison to the fried chicken. went also for lunch and the shrimp po boy was good.  this will be a place in my regular rotation!
No comment

Very delicious.  So tasty and flavorful. Very small venue.  The wait wasn't too bad on a Sunday night.  Food came quickly.  It was my first time.  It wasn't made clear that you needed to sign your name on a white board by the door to get a seat.  You also need to sign the board to sit at the bar.  I wanted takeout but there was no clear directions on how to get it because you can't get it at the bar. You needed to go to the back window and order.  There is no where to sit or stand so the only negative thing I have to say is that my food got cold cause no one told me it was ready!  It was just back there sitting with all the other to go orders getting cold.  The hot chicken is good.  Really good.   I ate greens for the side.  It was bomb too.  I generally don't like greens made at restaurants but these are exceptionally good.  The catfish nuggets were on point too!  Not over breaded or overcooked.  I'm going to go back and eat again before I head home!

Pretty nice staff and food was decent. I had the spicy fried chicken with a side of collard greens. The space is VERY small so be prepared to have to wait. To be honest I've had better fried chicken, but the intimate space and mason jars that they used for drinks gave it a nostalgic feel.

The food is good but the service is not good, I have been there about 5 times giving it a another chance every time  me and my husband goes. We love the fry chicken and the mac&cheese but when we went today 8/26/17 service sucks They mess up on my order not once, twice three times I guess it's just our luck. I won't be going back sorry to say the food and drinks or great but the service really  takes away from it.
Love this place, hate the Mosquitos, but it was a sacrifice because the food is delectable and the drinks (female bartender) are amazingly perfect!

I cant say enough about this place! Everything melts in your mouth because the ingredients are fresh and the flavor is there! Absolutely love this restaurant. I come back here everytime Im in Brooklyn and I will have it no other way!
No comment
Great place great atmosphere the chicken sandwich is the best ever. My second visit in a week yes it's that addicting.

Last time i ordered a cheeseburger medium rare it was RAW! Service and food here are totally mediocre IMO. Cant wait for more options to come to this rapidly gentrifying area. Ive lived around here for three years and i dont even view this place as an option anymore. Keep walking somewhere else
No comment

The only bad thing about this place is that everyone knows how awesome it is and it's a tiny space, so you will have to wait. The fried chicken is no joke (loooove the spicy Tennessee style) and service is great. Brunch is an especially good time to go.
No comment

Love this place! Pricing is very affordable. Fast service. Food was amazing. Nice ambiance. Highly recommend Gabby as your server! Her personality was out of this world. Very energetic, friendly, & attentive to her table! She constantly came by to check if we needed anything. Gabby, you're doing a wonderful job!! Thank you for your service!
No comment

column3: Town of Hempstead, Long Island, NY
column6: Horrible.  I've had better chicken sandwiches at KFC.  Long wait even though I was the one there.

I ate here with my wife and two close friends last weekend. Nobody in our party had ever had Nashville hot chicken, but all of us were very excited. We were seated promptly which is always a pleasant surprise for a Saturday night during prime business hours. We began with the fried green tomatoes which I would highly recommend as they were crispy, not dry, not greasy and the aioli tasted great. I chose the "hot" catfish, though I was very tempted to try the "extra hot" and I must say I am very thankful that I did not. The "hot" was certainly hot enough, but very flavorful. I tried my wife's chicken and it was perfectly crispy and juicy. The collard greens were amazing as was the mac and cheese. Service was friendly and attentive. It was a little loud for my liking, but I, admittedly, am feeling less and less attracted to more energetic venues. That said, I would not let that discourage you from trying this place! Overall, it was a wonderful experience and I am confident I will be back.

Had the hot chicken and it was true to its word, but also delicious. The crispy grits, kale and fries were all excellent sides. Very friendly service and while there was a line when we got there, we got a seat quickly.
No comment

Juicy, flavorful, mouthwatering fried chicken.  A tiny place with a big personality, this super cozy spot will absolutely satisfy that hankering for crispy fried chicken.  The mashed potatos are simple, the sides aren't bad in general.  Weekends will be packed to the brim.  Party's of six will fit but seriously... it's a tight fit.

Was very excited to come here. I'm a HUGE fan of Prince's in Nashville but don't get there as much as I used to. Food was excellent, service was great BUT, THIS IS NOT NASHVILLE HOT CHICKEN! It's very good, cooked very well, quality chicken and sides but nowhere near the original. I'll def recommend and return and even have the chicken again BUT unfortunately next time my craving flares up I'll need to jump on a flight to BNA.
No comment
No comment
No comment

The red,headed guy waiter sat 3 in a small 2-person table (probably 20 x 20) and assured me that "they've fit bigger people before" and it's "standard".  This has never been a policy to any restaurant I've ever been to.  Needless to say, brunch was cramped and uncomfortable.

Came here with my fiancé last weekend. Food was okay but service was horrible. One of the staff members stole items out of our shopping bag during our dinner. When we tried to lodge a complaint to the manager she completely dismissed us (she was definitely high). The food was good but not good enough to be disrespected and insulted. There are a million places in Brooklyn where I'd rather spend my money.

This place was phenomenal! The food was everything we expected, and the chicken was super crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside. The service was quick and courteous. We will be back soon to try their other dishes!

Believe the hype! The food in this spot is off the hook.  The space is indeed small - to put it nicely - cozy, intimate? Whatever the NYC version of small is - this place is small.  But the hot chicken is flavorful - I got hot which was very spicy.   The appetizer and sides were delightful.  The staff was friendly and efficient.  We'll definitely be back although we'll need to figure out the right day/time to go to avoid the wait.  With no indoor waiting area - it's hard to wait outside in the cold.
Good food and great prices. I got the French Toast breakfast with eggs and sausage and grits and it was delicious. Definitely some of the best grits I ever had!
They do one thing and they do it well. Tough to find real spicy fried chicken. For me it's not much but most people can't do the extra hot. If you can't do the extra hot then don't talk to me
No comment

Been here for dinner three times a charm. The service was ok. The food was just ok. Not the greatest and not flavorful in certain dishes like the mac & cheese. Not sure how people rave about it. At least the drinks is something to look forward to.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Food was excellent.  Wife had corn pancakes. On point!!!  I had the hot chicken with the bacon potatoes salad and the crispy grits. Everything we had was tasty. Definitely worth it. The price is also reasonable.

Went on Sunday night and there was a line, put our name on board... cool, respect that process, even for the bar.  But when two bar stools opened up and the bartender let her friend sit there (who had just walked in) I realized the process doesn't apply to friends of the bartender (she actually said "singles get priority"...LOL) One stool left, ok, we'll stand and order something to eat before a table becomes available.  Nope, she said we had to wait for two chairs.  Alright.  But after she treated her friend to a cocktail on the house, another two stools opened up and he decided to move over to be closer to his friends.  "No problem" she said. Not cool.  Thankfully when we finally sat at a table, the waiter was super friendly and accommodating (he was running his butt off too!).  So bad vibes from the bar means I won't go back. Wanted to like this place too, especially since its right next to Lovers Rock... but no can do!!!

I was here earlier, finally after months about hearing mixed criticisms about this place I got to check it out for myself. I think this is one of the better chicken spots around Bedford, but it falls short to a lot of 5-star rated Southern restaurants around here simply because the service is less than satisfying. I didn't take the reviews I read about this spot to heart but they were more or less right. My waitress was slow as molasses, and so inattentive she might as well have been deaf. Good thing the food was great though. The Nashville hot chicken sparked my taste buds and I loved every single bite of it.

This review is just for their fried chicken and it's pretty short: their fried chicken is really really good!! Moist meat and a crunch that is just right and not too heavy. My only quibble is that the hot and extra-hot versions are too hot, without any added flavour to justify the heat (you know what I'm saying?) and that's coming from a guy who's not spice- or heat-shy. Can't comment on the rest of the menu yet. Since we're in the neighbourhood, they're already on speed dial for delivery. Love me some Peaches.

Honestly, I was surprised at how good the food is. The long line outside was not deceiving. I ordered the fried green tomatoes, and corn cakes. Literally the best  corn cakes I've ever had. They were so good! I can taste them now. My friend ordered the Hot Chicken, she said it was delicious. It was a little out of the way, but I'd definitely say check it out.

Fuck this place. They pretty much ruined my 1st Father's Day. As I wrote our name on the board,  I ask if it's going to be a issue to sit inside as we have a stroller. I'm told "it won't be an issue". Fast forward one hour later and I'm told we have to sit outside as it's too tight for a stroller inside. WTF? You assholes should have told me am hour ago when I asked. I see a two top and a four top inside,  I ask if we could sit at the four top... I'm told no because it's only two of us. I now have to get some food through a drive thru add I have to head home, get ready and go to work.  FUCK THIS PLACE! THANKS FOR RUINING MY 1ST FATHER'S DAY!

It was my first time coming here... previously I've been to the Peaches branch which is about two blocks away. This place is a cozy little spot. We had to double check the tiny sign in the front window to make sure it's the right place. We got here around 1 pm on a Saturday. The bar was empty so we sat there. (The place got pretty busy around 2pm when we were leaving so I guess we got there just in time.) I ordered the granola crusted French toast with bourbon peaches and the husband had egg whites scrambled with kale, sundried tomatoes, and goat cheese with a side of crispy grits. Service was pretty quick and the food was good. We ordered coffees and only when the check came did we realize it was bottomless (free refills). Didn't really like the fact that they didn't have milk for the coffee and we had to use the tiny half and half cups. Overall, it was good but in the future I'll probably be going back to the Peaches branch in Lewis Ave. Their granola French toast with peaches and ice cream is super delicious (dessert option).

No one was in the restaurant. Sat for 15 minutes and no one took our order. Waitress was standing in the back texting. Left and went next door to Brown Butter. Another woman at the bar had been there for 20 minutes and didn't get to order. Pathetic.
No comment
Great spot for food and  drinks or just hanging at the bar. The fried chicken is delish!! Definitely will return for the third time!

Peaches HotHouse is pretty good for a southern style comfort food brunch. It is very small inside so it's not really great for large groups although I happened to go with a bunch of people. I had a pretty simple meal with scrambled eggs and cheese and sausage. Very good. I tried a few bites of my friend's fried chicken and while it was crispy and juicy, it was way too spicy for me. This brunch was good but nothing about it blew me away.
No comment
No comment
No comment
Great spot. Small but cozy seating (so get there early). Fried chicken, French toast and grits were excellent. Also has great cocktails of the brunch and breakfast variety. Highly recommended.

So Impressed with this place, the food was more than delicious, had  a mild chicken sandwich, greatness, tried the mac and cheese, to die for and the collard greens, Wow, and for dessert the chocolate cake , I was in heaven, will come back for more!!!!

Stopped here for a quick brunch and for the most part it was a pleasurable experience.The ambiance was great and I was seated pretty quickly. I also received my drink and meal (Jim Cade breakfast) pretty fast as well, which is always a plus. But, I was slightly underwhelmed by my meal. I've heard nothing but great things about the chicken, so I expected something mind blowing and mine was pretty regular. It was crispy and well cooked on the outside but slightly under-cooked and mushy on the inside, which was a bit off-putting. Besides the chicken, my fried grits were tasty, french toast was delicious and my eggs were pretty regular. Oh and the drink was nice and strong! Looking past the disappointing chicken, I would definitely return to this establishment!

Love this place, I end up going once a week. The fried green tomatoes, wedge salad, BBQ shrimp and catfish sliders are all solid. Also love their mac and cheese, collard greens, fried chicken and fried shrimp. The space is tiny so get there early on weekends if you don't want to wait
No comment
No comment
This place is not the sister to no damn peaches the food sucks and you only have 3 mains to chose from and it doesn't sound not looks good. Major disappointment!

My friend and I came here twice and I must say, that both times the chicken was amazing. The first time I had the mild fried chicken but the extra hot chicken is the best!!!! I recommend this spot to anyone who wants a taste of some southern fried chicken.

You might want to avoid times when it's crowded. We were seated after a short wait, then waiter came to check in, disappeared for an uncomfortably long time, took our orders and then we waited, and waited and waited an even more uncomfortably long time. My fried chicken was cold; clearly it had been sitting around while other dishes were being prepared. They never brought companion her drink. Food was pretty good, although their idea of "spicy" chicken is taking basic fried chicken and sprinkling cayenne on the crust. Why not just put the spices on table and let us do that ourselves? Maybe I'll be back, but only if it's really empty....
No comment

A nice chill setting with no unnecessary frills. Great food. I had fried shrimp and my partner had the chicken. Both were very good. Service was very good, attentive but not invasive. I would definitely recommend this spot.
They have the best mashed potatoes I've had in a very long time and their fried spicy chicken.
One of my favorite places in the area for Brunch. Can't wait to go back and have more of those sweet potato fries!

Love this little neighborhood gem! It's rather small and the service is somewhat inefficient so be prepared to wait. Oh, and if your party is 4 or more people, good luck. While I don't think the food is anything special per se (can be dry/bland), the drinks are great and so is the vibe...so we keep coming back!
No comment

This place is awesome. The food and drinks are great and so gentle on the pocket. My friend and I each had an app, an entree and two drinks. Our bill was only $40 each. I recommend the shrimp and grits or the hot chicken.

The hot fried chicken was way too spicy and I eat spicy all the time. I imagine the extra hot is killer. Seasoning on chicken was decent. Fried grits and collard greens were a plus. Very strong drinks - they didn't have the Etta James but the host recommended Sister Rosetta, which was a bit too sweet for me, but not too shy on the alcohol.

The place is small not a whole lot of seating. Had the fried green tomatoes served with crunchy bacon and arugula. the presentation and food was soooo goood. Also had their hot chicken. Yum seasoned right and juicy. I will definitely be back for more. My husband had the burger and was very tempted to order another one.

Probably the best fried chicken I've ever had in a restaurant, period! The catfish nuggets are amazing. The drinks are too damn good to have just one! I wish they opened earlier during the week. But I'm glad they're in business. You'll be sure to find all the local hipsters there with their bikes chained to the fences or neighborhood trees. The menu is very simple. The staff is super casual and very friendly. I highly recommend this place as it is slowly becoming one of my favorite places to ever hang out and grab a drink/bite to eat.
Fabulous drink menu with any possible porch tea creation you could imagine. Hot chicken is the staple

Peaches is hoppin'!! This is one of our go-to places for a good meal. The inside is small so it's always full, but it's a nice cozy atmosphere.  The specialty drinks are super strong, and super cheap during happy hour. And the fried chicken is awesome. I almost always order that or the spicy, hot version. Everything on the menu is great- you can't go wrong.

thank you peaches for dishing up delicious, AFFORDABLE (ok, you pay a bit - BUT get what you pay for!) - (ie: it's not like these tiny portions at ridiculous prices).  and when you get a drink, you get a DRINK xoxo  the food is amazing, i've never been disappointed.  went in today for a (rare : ) splurge, and had another great meal, great drink, and the kindest, most wonderful experience overall - big thanks to shavon and meek for their amazing skillz and many talents in customer service and human kindness xoxo  they went way above and beyond, and i am so truly grateful to them for showing me so much love!  (right back 'atchya xoxo)  i will be coming back again soon!  : )  (as soon as i can!  : )  great to know there's still some places left that are accessible to all xoxo  (even if it's for a splurge  : )
No comment

This is based on one tasting, but I liked everything I had: Catfish nuggest, blackened catfish, mac n cheese, hot chicken. I usually don't order blackened anything as I literally think its going to taste burned, but this was deep and spicy and flavorful. The mac n cheese was the creamy version but tasty. The collared greens were good, a touch too salty perhaps but not too vinegary and not cooked to mush which made me happy. Will definitely be back for more.
Great service. Great food. Great atmosphere. AWESOME SALAD and cornbread!

I went to this restaurant with my daughter and wife. Not really knowing if this was a family friendly spot. Needless to say the staff and the atmosphere were very welcoming. They have high chairs for toddlers, along with variety of foods for children. It's very intimate, I would recommend this location for a FIRST DATE!

Very good home cooked food.  The Booker T was very good.  It could have use some sort of sauce though.  The hot sauce blend that they provided was bland. This place is small so be prepared to wait.  Also, the service was a bit slow. It was all worth it for the bourbon pound cake.
No comment
I just expected more from the reviews I read.  The food didn't make me want more.

I am only giving it three stars because they did not have their thing together on a Sunday night.    We knew that it was going to be good food, but it seems like everyone else did, so it took a LONG time to be seated.   BUT, when we got our hot chicken dishes, we enjoyed them a lot.    Dont try the hot chicken or even the extra hot if you are not prepared for a lot of water.   as noted in other posts, the drinks are definitely strong.  I had the Memphis Millie
A hole in the wall with good fresh fried chicken and a nice happy hour for drinks.  Double the price of Popeyes but well worth it.
No comment

I absolutely love this place.  The mac and cheese. Meatless collards.  Brunch. ..The cocktails,  outdoor seating, smooth and chill ambiance amongst educated Brooklyn professionals.  It's definitely worth the wait.
This is my favorite fried chicken joint in Brooklyn! Awesome food (don't miss the burgers,appetizers and sides), yummy drinks, and a very welcoming staff and atmosphere. Excellent job!

I had the Hot fried chicken with creamy grits. This really really is amazing!!! It was VERY spicy, crispy & delicious. This is a a special place (no joke) Highly recommended.. The creamy grits were heavenly.

First time here! Been dying to go! Cousin in town so we checked it out! Small spot! Told us a 45 minute wait but since it was just us 2, table became available quick! A plus! $5 happy hour drinks. 2nd plus! Had the Muddy Waters which was good. Cousin tried the fried grits and hot fried chicken which she was very pleased with! I went simple with scrambled eggs, bacon and grits! I was satisfied!  For dessert we shared bourbon pound cake and ice cream! Delicious! Wont wait for family to be in town to return!

Finally tried this spot. Not sure if the wait was too long or if I was just really hungry. I had the hot chicken, it was good but the side of kale was the star of the dish for me. I would definitely go back again.

Delicious food doesn't mean liberty for sloppy service. My friend and I ordered two identical burgers and they served only one. I immediately told them we had ordered two, and they said "oh sure, it's coming in two minutes." They served the second burger 15 minutes after with no apology, as if nothing happened. I wish they admitted they messed up the order and I would still think it's okay. But they pretended as if they didn't and then didn't do anything to take the blame on. I will never go back.
Peaches HotHouse is by far some of my favorite fried chicken in New York. Get it Extra Hot and slather it with some hot sauce. Might be burnin later but its ooo so worth it.
I ordered the fried shrimp & grits. The food was cold. the cheese wasn't even melted on the grits. The shrimps were bland no seasoning.  Wasn't impressed with this place won't be returning.

Hi, table for tw--wait where are you going? I was trying to put my name in! Oh never mind, I see there's some seating at the bar, let's just sit there. Hi can I get tw--oh sorry you're saying I have to put my name in to sit at the bar? Huh, that's really unusual. Alright, let's stay patient, we'll wait till the hostess gets back.
